text:
33cl bottle in snifter. STRAIGHT FROM CALI (La Jolla) in the luggage, BIG THANKS TO BOB AS ALWAYS !! 
Pours a moderate, but dense, 1-2 fingers head, off white appearance; deep golden to orange color, with some light haziness. Smells really fresh and nice from the beginning: mango, pine, lime, all mixed on a minty background. Taste orange peel, tropical ripe, earthy, rich malts, resin, typical west coast. Really quite sustained but at the end pleasing bitterness, medium sweetness + that also kicks in. Very nice on the nose, with a bold and complex taste profile, maybe not as sophisticated as other indians from alesmith but still very solid.

Bottle: Clear, hint of copper color, with good head and lace. Citrus zest and tropical. Some caramel. Its a little closed. Mix of hops and malt. Dense. The palate is very big and rich but balanced. 
Ive tasted more enjoyable DIPAs but this is a very solid beer with no rough edges.

The greatness of the Alesmith IPA amped up! Light copper color with a large head of creamy white foam. Juicy grapefruit and fresh squeezed tangerine supported by a sweet, full bodied, yet clean and not over the top caramel base. Again, very juicy citrus and dank.

Bottle. Heavy malty and heavy hoppy. Aroma of citrus, orange and grapefruit with earthy, spicy and piney notes. Caramel backbone. Starts sweet and finish bitter with some alcoholic notes. Medium body and juicy texture.

Appearance- slightly murky amber, a 1-2 finger solid off-white head of which lasts well. Aroma- pithy orange, grapefruit, tangerine, caramel malt, hops, more orange, hint of pineapple, fruit juice. Taste- orange, boozy tropical fruit, hop resin, fluffy malt, sweet caramel, raisin and fruitcake hints, sticky hop resin, pineapple and grapefruit hints, biscuity caramel malt in the background, juicy fruit. Full and slightly sticky mouthfeel, sweet boozy finish. Excellent stuff.
Bottle 0,65. Pours a bit hazy orange with large white head, nice lacing and good retention. Citrus, grapefruit, grassy, pine, malty,. Full body, soft carbonation, quite sweet.
Bottle. Cloudy orange with white top. Strong malt biscuit hoppy aroma. Bitter sweet with hoopy flora and sweet nalt bisuit notes.

Bottle. Deep golden/orange body with a frothy, white head. Aroma of resin, grapefruit, toasted grain, alcohol. The flavor is moderately sweet and lightly to moderately bitter. It finishes lightly to moderately sweet and moderately to heavily bitter. Medium to full body, watery texture, lively carbonation. Resin, pine and grapefruit taste with strong sweet malt backbone thats a bit too much.

Pas grand fan de ce genre de DIPA assez maltée (moins que dautres en loccurrence) et éthylique qui coupe les houblons.
Le nez est tres agrumes, noisette et amande, petit fond de fraicheur qui pointe (qui me fait dire que cest dommage).
Bouche peu amère. On ressent énormément les côtés noisettes amandes et des touches dagrumes. Finale tres seche pour du 8.5 plutôt amère et agréable, assez aromatique.

Brutal! De color naranja, turbia con una capa de espuma compacta. En nariz cítrica y herbal. En boca recuerdo dulce, luego pino. Resinosa y amarga, bien balanceada por la malta. La malta le da un toque dulce. Alcohol bien integrado aunque se nota. Lastima que no tenga etiqueta con fecha de consumo preferente.

UPDATED: APR 14, 2017 Bottle. Pours unclear orange with medium to large white head - durable, excellent lacing. Aroma of pine, resin, flowers, citrus in background. Taste is light fruity sweet and medium to heavy bitter, at first pine, but also with lots of citrus, tropical fruits, grapefruit, tangerine. Lasting, pleasant bitterness. Medium+ body, oily texture, average carbonation. Very tasty, smooth, hoppy DIPA, but it is probably greater and more aromatic when its fresh.

UPDATED: MAR 1, 2017 12 oz bottle last July from Total Wine in Rancho Cucamonga. Good pine and citrus aroma. Pours with a one inch head with great lacing. Mouthfeel is medium-full bodied with a great balance between bitterness and maltiness. Overall a wonderful DIPA. Pliny may have the edge in taste and aroma, but the ease of getting this makes it a stellar stand-in.

Hazy golden orange beer with big and long lasting head. Aroma has malts, caramel, some citrus. Not very fresh, neither is the taste, which has malts, caramel, soap, pepper and some bitter citrus feeling at the end. Full body, low carbonation, quite sweet with drier and more bitter end. Could be more fresh.

aroma of oranges and wheat along with some pine mostly very inviting..appearance is cloudy slightly amber orange liquid with off white head some lacing..taste is dry bitter west coast IPA citrus fruity with a definite pine bitterness and slightly fruity sweetness..palate is fairly dry and tingly but long lasting finish..over all no surprise its a summer beer lots of summery citrusy flavors good double IPA
Bottle.Golden with a medium head.Hoppy with a strong floral presence. So easy to drink that it is easy to forget its strength.Left lots of lacing and a happy memory. A good one.

(draught) opalescent golden colour with a creamy off-white head. aroma of kiwi and bretty funk, heavily perfumed, with lots of brown sugar, some cherry juice, sweatsocks and bread dough. flavour is mostly mango, brown sugar and gently roasted malts, with a hint of herbal hops, some yeast and a light-bitter peppermint finish. heavy-bodied with average carbonation.

Aroma: candy, spruce, resin
Taste: medium bitter, resin, spruce, candy, light alcohol

Small bottle at home. Beautiful cloudy orange colour, creamy offwhite head. Incredibly rich orange zesty, tangerine fruity hops and big sweet malts in the nose. Taste is oily, resinous, orange and caramel sweet, finishing with a building bitterness in the aftertaste. Huge body, medium carbonation.
Draft served in tulip. Aroma of faint orange. Not overpowering in hops or fruit. Very smooth t through the finish. Good pacing and acceptable aftertaste.
Perfect balance of citrus, malt and spicy hop backbone, with the abv covered up well through the creamy finish.

12oz bottle at home bought from Saveur Biere (I think). Bottled 04/27/2016. amber clear color, medium big yellowish head. smells of resin, parfumy, candy, spices, caramel, lightly peppery, smells ok but rather old hoppy. full body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes of resin, candy, spices, a bit soapy, some lychee, lemon grass, peppery, rather old hoppy again. finshes rather dry and lightly bitter with notes of resin, lychee and some spices. drinks still pretty good but the hop notes are all kind heavy / lack crispness / totally lacks any freshness. Overall in this state drinks quite heavy.

Bue à la pression. Belle couleur orangée, pas trop trouble, bonne mousse. Au nez ce nest pas de la grosse folie à priori. Quelques notes de caramel et de pin, mais ce nest pas super flagrant. En bouche on est sur le résineux mais qui est quand même pas mal dominé par des notes de caramel. Cest rond, cest goûtu, cest plaisant à boire, mais y a mieux en Double IPA.

500ml pint glass enjoyed at La Mise en Bière Bar - Lausanne. Pours a cloudy dark orange to amber color forming a medium creamy tan head with good retention and lots of lacings formed and left in the glass. Nose is VERY grassy, fruity and refreshing! Delicious. Notes of grapefruit and pine. Citrus and hop flowers. Becomes deliciously dry and bitter. Smooooooooth AleSmith style. Medium body and carbonation. Grapefruit and pine in the aftertaste. Excellent drinkability. Masterpiece.

Hazy amber/gold color; Medium slightly creamy body; Aroma of pine hops, floral, citrus, & some caramel malt; Flavor of sweet malt, caramel, pine hops, citrus (notably grapefruit), and some spice; Finish is bitter; The alcohol is fairly well hidden; Nicely balanced; Another great brew from AleSmith.

Medium gold, clear, billowing head, no lace. 
Wonderfully hoppy nose. 
Full body, dense flavor, good mouthfeel with discrete heat, high carbonation, lingering palate. 
Very bitter but not too dry. 
Hoppy, herbal, resiny. 


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aromat: dominują nuty chmielowe - cytrusy, zioła i owoce tropikalne, choć mogły by być świeższe. Następnie karmel, chleb, ciastka i alkohol. Ogólnie jednak raczej słodko i przyjemnie. Strach pomyśleć, co byłoby, gdyby piwo było świeże. 
 
Wygląd: barwa złota, klarowna z ładną biało- żółtą pianą, która jest umiarkowanej wielkości i podobnie trwała, ale ładnie zdobi szkło.
 
Smak: umiarkowana słodycz i wyraźne nuty słodowe, które występują tylko w piwach z USA. Trudno określić o jakie konkretnie chodzi. Chyba najbliżej im do ciastek zbożowych, ale są nie do podrobienia. Występuje spora nuta alkoholowa. Goryczka dosyć wysoka, ale nieźle zbalansowana, przez co nie zalega. Krągła pełnia, umiarkowane do wysokiego wysycenie i słodowo, alkoholowo, chmielowy finisz. Niezłe piwo, ale miałem nadzieję na więcej. Nie zmienia to jednak faktu, że piwa z tego browaru znoszą transport do Polski lepiej niż inne.

It pours golden with a slightly off white head and plenty of lacing. It has stone fruit aromas that feature peach and apricot. There are apricot, peach, caramel, and floral flavors. It has a moderate feel with high bitterness and alcohol warming Overall, the flavors of peach and apricot start off sweet and turn to bitter and is long lasting through the finish.

UPDATED: NOV 1, 2016 Interessanterweise tranken wir dieses Bier zeitgleich mit CIGAR CITYs JAI ALAI IPA und benoteten alle Bewertungskriterien identisch, mit dem Zusatz das von allem ein bisschen mehr stattfindet, was allerdings nicht zu einem besserem Abschneiden des ALESMITH Klassikers führte. Trotzdem, cooles Bier. 55DKK für 0,2l. Tap in der MIKKELLER & FRIENDS BAR Kopenhagen.
Bottle - Nice deep orange pour with a medium head. Nice hop aroma and taste. Light pine and resin. Medium body and dry.
Bottle. Quite clear, yellow in colour, solid head. Not much from hops, mainly malt, caramel, some biscuits. Medium sweet, soft carbonation and medium bitter and astringent finish.

Bottle from Saveur-Biere.com - Color: clear golden blond beer with small carbonation and medium heavy white foam. Smell: fruity and resinous hops. Pine domination. Sweet pine and caramel resin. Taste: full body with caramel sweet malt very intensive hops domination with resin and pine hint. Fruity and caramel. Really good balance and very drinkable. Aftertaste: toffee and pine hoppy. Dry bitterness, really good.
On tap. Hazy golden color with solid white head. Citrus aroma, some pine. In the taste, first come the citrus, then some malty/caramel touch and some alcohol. Very nice.

Sweet, fruity aroma with some herbal and flower notes and quite a big malty but yet fresh and crisp background. In taste its super dry. Has no malty sweetness at all. First punch is herbal, maybe even aniseed. Then has some fruity notes, but still dry, crisp. Almost perfect bitterness in the aftertaste - short, clean; fruity and leafy in the same time. Its extremely drinkable for an imperial IPA, which is nice, but I also like some body in such a big beer. It definately is an amazing beer in overall.

On tap, 25cL. @Angers, France. @Donalds pub. A hazy opaque amber beer with a medium white foamy head ; medium retention ; ok lacing. Fruity resinous nose, red berries (blackberry), light caramel, bread, alcohol note. Medium sweet, medium dry bitter warming with fresh episodes ; great balance. Good body, average texture, light oily, average carbonation, fruity resinous finish. Overall, delicious gourmet ! Fruity hoppy, nice body.

Clear deep gold heading to copper. Medium creamy off-white head, decent lace. Big dank tropical aroma, dank aroma, little bit of citrus, finish is heavier on the grapefruit. Excellent west coast double IPA.

Always wanted to try the summer yulesmith. Now that I can get it by this name, it seemed like it would be just another IIPA, but it is better. Appearance is clear, gold, fluffy head, thick retention. Nose is mild tropical and floral. Mouthfeel is soft, lush, low carb feel, and very melony taste which seemed unusual. Then a nice hop dryness. Very well done.

UPDATED: APR 13, 2017 Barwa jasnożółta. Obfity, biały kożuch piany, który długo się utrzymuje i ładne oblepia szkło. Intensywny aromat cytrusów - pomarańcza i grejpfrut na pierwszym planie, lekko z tyłu cytryna, delikatny ananas. W smaku pojawia się owocowa słodycz, jest brzoskwinia, pomarańcza. Zaraz po tym daje o sobie znać solidna goryczka. Mimo swojej intensywności jest przyjemna, przypomina skórkę pomarańczy czy grejpfruta. Ani trochę nie zalega. Alkohol praktycznie nie istnieje. Wysycenie jest dość wysokie. Piwo jest bardzo pijalne, orzeźwiające, mega owocowe

Almost clear amber pour with a dense white head. Sticky lacing. Strong citrus rind, pine, and dank aroma. Taste is citrus zest, grapefruit, dank, pine, and some toffee sweetness. Firm bitterness but not overpowering. Medium sticky body. ABV is completely hidden. Very easy drinking.

330ml bottle from Saveur-Biere. Bottled 04/27/16.


Golden colour with a white head. Strong, bitter, fruits, grapefruit, dryness, alcohol. Could be fresher and better.
Pine and tropical fruit on the nose.Smooth on the tongue and resiny on the finish. More pine, ripe citrus, caramel malts and a bit of booze.

This is a tasty, dank, west-coast style IPA that I really enjoyed. It pours hazy yellow with head that hangs around for a while and a lot of carbonation. This beer has that classic big-hop stank all over it with a little bit of buttery malt, and the flavor is that in spades. Plus, some sweet fruity notes, peaches, maybe mango too. The carbonation dominates the mouth feel, which doesnt bother me. Alesmith Double IPA is eally tasty. Im digging this.
Pours clear dark gold with some head and lots of lacing. Nose is dank and fruity. Flavours of peach and grapefruit. Taste med bitter light sweet. Medium sticky body lively sweet.
Bottle 12 fl oz at home, Nivala. Colour is slightly cloudy light orange with small white head. Aromas and flavors: Fruits, pine, resiny, caramel, hops and malts little bit of musty, maybe old bottle.

Bottle (from saveur-biere). Pours dark golden-amber with whiteish head. The head stays. Aroma is very hoppy, piney, malty some caramel sweetness. Flavor is sweet and bitter, pine, malt, caramel. Finish is pine-dry bitter with lingering sweetness and bit of booze. Very drinkable, everything is well balanced. Despite being very hoppy it doesnt feel harsh. Overall: great beer, classic US hoppy style brew.

Bottle from Specs. Pale, hazy amber with a resilient, pillowy, cream colored head with lots of lacing. Aroma of juicy citrus, caramel, white cake, flowers. Taste is very floral; a bit fruity, slightly sweet, and moderately bitter. Medium bodied and very smooth. NICE.

Bottle, pours almost clear golden with beautiful high and very stable white head.
Complex aroma of citrus fruits, flowers, resin but as well hay,and a bit of caramel.
Nice balance in taste between sweetness and bitterness. Very easy to drink considering the high abv. Really nice.
Poured a yellowy orange from bottle. Loads of pine and citrus, some malts. Pretty good

Poured from the bomber cloudy dark orange with thick head. taste is an abundance of hops, strong, pine, some citrus, and very easy drinking, note to self: the next time I say to myself "I should probably get two of these" listen to myself, because this was good, and will probably be sold out by the time I get back.

Aroma: intense fruitiness and bitterness; Appearance: slightly hazy light amber pour with thin white head; Taste: big hops balanced with malty backbone; Palate: medium body with long, bitter finish; Overall: delicious. Would buy again and again.

Bottle. 
Clear golden pour, frothy white head. 
Hoppy nose. Taste is hoppy, less fruit and bitterness than expected. 
Medium body, average carbonation.

Citrus, floral and honey aroma. Pours golden with white lacy foam. Taste is dry with lots of citrus - grapefruit, pomelo, lime. High bitterness at the finish, well hidden alcohol. Overall extremely drinkable, excellent DIPA.

12 oz. bottle. Pours a clear golden color with a thick white head. Aroma is very fruity, with citrus, grapefruit and pine. Taste is citrus, grapefruit, pine, and caramel. Great balance. Long bitter finish. Excellent.

Tap at Clubhouse BFD. Pours orange golden. White creamy head. Aroma is sweet orange, citrus, mango, sweet. Nice. Flavor is sweet sugary boozy, orange, orange rind. Bitter finish. Really nice from Alesmith as usual.

Bottle 
Orange hazy, thick white head.
Aroma of malt and honey 
Slight sweet fluffy, balanced bitter orange and honey

Cloudy amber, thick offwhite head. Fruity and caramely aroma, some pine too. Smells pretty fresh. Flavour has caramel and woody pine. Starts off creamy, then turns bitter and dry, just barely shy of being too rough. Warming alcohol bite and good balance. I like it.

Appearance: Hazy medium copper. Finger of white tiny bubbles leaving good lace.
Nose: sweeter medium candy malts. Aspects of pine, citrus and tropical fruit. 
Taste: sweet medium malts, citrus, tropical fruit and touch of pine. Honey. 
Body: Medium with good texture. Decent carbonation.
Parting thoughts: a very solid DIPA. Hoppy, yet sweet with a good alcohol hit.

Location: Bottle from Whole Foods Market in Redwood City, CA
Aroma: All kinds of citrus...tangerine, grapefruit, oranges and pine
Taste: Very bright citrus marmalade mixed extremely well with pine
Palate: Juicy but bright
Overall: This has an excellent balance of bright citrus with thick pine.

Sampled on draft at 3R6P this beer poured a cloudy peach color with a medium sized fluffy white head that lingered and left good lacing. The aroma was sweet pine, lemon and tropical fruit. The flavor was sweet and tangy with cactus, pine, lemon, pineapple and mango. Long finish that turned a bit dry. Moderately full bodied. Ok.

Poured from a 12 oz bottle into a tulip. Slightly hazy orange-gold with a frothy white head. Lots of lacing the glass. Great aromas of grapefruit and pine. Medium to heavy bitter, full body. Lively carbonation and a long, bitter finish.

(355ml bottle from boxbeers.dk, date code illegible) Pours clear medium orange with a big pile of long-lasting white froth and lots of lace. Aroma of tangerine, white grapefruit, candied peach, grass, spicy, some pine resin over reasonably sweet malt with some honey and bread to it. Palate is semi-sweet with a mix of orange, tangerine, lime, guava and pine up front over some light bread notes. FInish is dry and rather bitter with citrus oil, pith, pine, resin, spicy hops and a touch of alcohol heat. Medium, oily body with fairly low carbonation. Its a bottle of AleSmith in Europe so surely not as fresh and bright as it could be,

This was poured into a shifter.
The appearance was a orange (peach skin), color with a thin white foamy head atop of the beer. Thin delicate sticky lacing clings to the glass.
The aroma starts off with sweet tangerines, grapefruits and peaches and slides over top of a nice caramel backbone.
The flavor starts sticky with the blend of the hops to the malts, and adds a light bitter resin for balance. Theres a sly dry peachy to caramel aftertaste leading into the finish.
On the palate, this one sat about a light to medium on the body with a nice sessionability about it. Carbonation runs light. Bitter resin shows some harshness but not too much.
Overall, its a good West coast styled DIPA that I could have again.

Bottle from Tanakaya. Pours a clear orange with a finger of head that dissipates fairly quickly leaving a thin ring around the glass edge. Lovely orange aromas with some tangerine and light caramel and pine resin. Very citrus forward in that classic west coast way. Some honey and caramel on the palate, but with fine, prickly carbonation and even though it is balanced it still feels light in the mouth. Bitter finish with more orange and citrus notes. Very nice.

Clear copper with a golden tint. Small white ring head. Weak lace lies only near the top of the half pint. Aroma is piny and finishes with a bit of caramel. Flavor is bitter fruit and medium all around. Very drinkable. I guess its awesome if youre trying to get ur buzz on in rapid fashion.
Bottle. Clear dark amber pour with tan head. Aroma has lots of rasin, grass and sweet apricot. Taste is balanced with hoppy bitterness and nice malty backbone. Medium heavy body

Bottle at Fraunces Tavern in FiDi. Pours a clear golden with a medium white head that leaves very nice lacing. Nose is of caramel and sugary fruits, like you rolled some peach slices in some white sugar. Taste is moderately sweet and moderately bitter with some good pine notes. Doesnt feel too boozy at all. Moderate body and carbonation, lingering bitter piny finish. Nicely built really and quite enjoyable!

Pours an almost clear colour with a white one finger foam. Noses pretty malty.. Sadly. This is a few months old but that is the reality of buying us ipas in Europe, they are rarely fresh and that is a real shame. And we landed on the Moon and shit. Tastes pretty malty too. Seems like any dankness or hoppy fruityness has just disappeared. Might not be a fair rating but what can you do?
aroma is piney, grapefruit zest. flavor is super hoppy, bitter, piney. pours a hazy gold with a thick sticky white head. had out of a 12oz bottle at home..nice double ipa

On tap at Lunar Brewing Co. and snifter served displaying a clear, orangey gold color, with a fluffy layer of soft white head foam, and web-like lacing. The nose was sweet, malty creaminess, with esters as tropical fruit, grapefruit, pineapple, and light resin. Medium+ bodied, with decent carbonation, and a little silkiness to the mouthfeel, the taste added a strong, citrus & rind bitterness, smoothed by a touch of malty sweetness, and intensified by a warming, but non-boozy alcohol presence. Solid DIPA.

On tap at brewpub. A slightly hazy golden with a nice white head. Aroma is grapefruit, lemon, lime, conifer. Flavor is conifer, grapefruit, lemon and lime. Finish is herbal, citrus, conifer, nice, strong bitterness, lingers on. Full body, average carbonation.

Big bottle. Slight haze orange color with a white head. Lot of head retention. Tropical fruit citrus hops aroma. Citrus floral juicy orange resin hops flavor with a light bitter finish. Medium body. Complex and clean.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Cloudy straw color with white head. Rich tropical and dank aroma. Biscuitty malt with lots of tropical dank apricot, mango, lemon peel. Long linger bitterness is balanced by a lingering sweetness. Nice west coast DIPA. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Grapefruit and orange nose, touch of gym sock, pineapple accents. Hazy amber, medium yellow head, minimal lace. Grapefruit, marigold, orange flesh, and triple sec. Lasting grapefruit finish. Medium body, easy carbonation. Quite nice, full of fruity hops.

Bottle pour. Very rich yet balanced. Not super hoppy. Nice bitterness on the palate. Good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12oz bottle poured at home with a bottled on date of 4/26/2016.

Was expecting a little more on the aroma side - but the appearance and taste make up for it.

Had a great lingering taste...plenty of carbonation.

Very solid beer!

12 oz bottle shared by ebone1988 with Gus and I. The pour is a brighter golden yellow with a hefty white head that falls to a bubbly collar. The aroma is pretty malty. I dont like it. There is a bit of citrus and some hop present, but the malts really are pissing me off. Its not that great. The flavor is a little better, but not much. Malty as hell. The citrus and juiciness makes it a little more tolerable. Its just a disappointment all around. The mouth feel is interesting. Its thicker and carries a nice carbonation but has a lingeringly malty and light citrus aftertaste. Interesting, but not my jam at all.

Bottle shared with koleminer20 and Gus. Bottle date 4/28/2016. Aroma is old. Weird. Malt, citrus, tropical fruit, pine. Appearance is golden amber, off white head, mostly clear. Taste is citrus, a terrible amount of malt, pine, bitter malt. Mouthfeel is light to medium body, light crisp carbonation, bitter malt and pine aftertaste. Overall, severely disappointing for a beer well within the drinking window.

UPDATED: FEB 10, 2017 Butelka 0,65 l.
Aromat sosnowy, żywiczny, cytrusowy, w tle nuty karmelowe.
Barwa złoto-pomarańczowa, lekko zamglona. Piana obfita, biała, dość drobna. Szybko redukuje się do kożuszka, lekko zdobi szkło.
Smak lekko słodki i umiarkowanie gorzki.
Cytrusy, owoce tropikalne, przyprawy, karmel. Goryczka żywiczno-grejprutowa, finisz wytrawny.
Wysycenie średnie.
Tap @ Savory Grain. Nice looking with big head and lacing. Smells nice & grapefruity and dank with a faint sweet peach. Nice and robust and bitter. Slightyly astringent.

Pours a clear gold with white head. A great aroma of pine, citrus, hop, and other fruity notes. A citrus hop taste with a balanced caramel, pine, fruit, and malt taste. A balanced aftertaste of bitter hops with some caramel malts.

Bomber from Whole Foods Market Fair Lakes
Aroma: pine, caramel, citrus
Appearance: clear golden with a white head
Taste: medium sweetness, medium bitterness, 
Palate: medium body, sticky, average carbonation, bitter, 

Delicious IIPA

Havent had this one in years. 6 pack bottles from rozis for 15.99. Pour is medium Golden with thin white head. Aroma is pine, citrus, resin and toasted bread. Flavor has some malt up front with a very piney resinous hop punch. The malt is definitely there for the style but the bitter hops and pine are big. Has the original California ipa flavor and a very long bitter finish. Reminds me of moylans double ipa, which we cant get in cle anymore!

I think mine might not be super fresh, or my palate is skewed from earlier dinner or who knows what. Aroma is very citrusy. Flavor is largely caramel malt and some citrus with quite a good deal of bitterness which isnt quite dry nor juicy. ABV is too apparent for my tastes, with an ABV burn happening. Its obviously a great DIPA, I think this bottle just isnt a prime example of it.
Bomber->tulip. Orange-gold with big frothy offwhite head. A: juicy citrus hops with some floral notes. T: zesty citrus and floral hops, pine. Biting. Excellent, very clean and refreshing.

UPDATED: JUN 19, 2016 What a treat this is. 
Solid gold pour, gleaming like the Olympic medal it so richly deserves.  
Nose explodes with tons of floral perfume and pine resin. After a swirl, defined pineapple, mango, red apple, tea, lemon curd, young stonefruit. Nothing too ripe about this one except some juicy peachy/apple notes.  
The sip starts of coniferous and sweetly floral, easing down to under-ripe tropical fruit, beautifully austere bitterness, a paper-thin coating of delicate caramel malt. A nearly bone-dry finish, with the exception of pine resin, green banana peel, and white flower lingering along the tongue.   I enjoyed this before two great (and familiar) brews (3 Floyds Gumballhead and Space Station), and this brew was a renewal to my palate. "Juicy" is no adjective applicable to this beer; it is resinous, perfume-blasted, youthfully tropical, and BITTER.   This is a hopheads fantasy. If you want a ripe, sweet tropical blend, dont even bother. This ones a pure west-coast tongue gripper.

Tangerine, pineapple, black tea and pine aromas are well balanced and compliment the caramel sweetness. Not too bitter with a nice touch of subtle spice, it makes this a little different. Not a palate smasher but not for the timid either. Excellent but a bit overpriced.
Draught. Deep orange yellow pour with a thin off white head. Aroma of mangoes, citrus, pine, vanilla and cereal. Thick mouthfeel with a snappy finish.

Smell of Peach pineapple mango and a touch of lemongrass. Sweet bitter scent that follows after the all the hop scents. Fiarly clear copper color with small off white head that fades quickly. Tangerine and Orange coming through at first then followed by sweet malts with nice Delishous long bite that tends to linger in a good way. Medium body that lasts for days with perfect amount of carbonation that tickles the tougue just right. Love this brew has everything that a great IPA should have. Great brew!

22 oz bottle shared by DCLawyer, thanks Jason! Clear golden orange with off-white head. Aromas of biscuit, floral notes, light citrus. Tastes of citrus, floral notes, light biscuit, malt. Medium body with a dry finish. Good.

Bottle from Meditrina.Golden with slight chill haze and lasting white head and lace. Orange rind and pine and spice aroma with a hint of caramel or toffee. Wicked long bitter pine and orange rind bitter finish. Medium slick body very fine carbo. Old school wicked fucking chewy palate-wrecker DIPA. Very nicely made but way too bitter. Ive probably ruined my palate for the night.

Bottle poured into a tulip glass..golden/copper with a
fluffy white head..aroma of tropical fruits,pine,biscuits.
.tastes of grapefruit,kiwi,mango,cracker malt..medium
body..solid.
Bottle. Pours a hazy orange color with a foamy white head. Notes of brown sugar, citrus rind, fruit gum, and flowers. Feels like it is lacking a malt backbone.

Pour is a murky orange with a small white head. Aroma is an almost perfect match of pine and fruity hops. I get a big mango and pineapple coming off the beer. Flavor is a full on assault of fruit hops. Mango, pineapple and kiwi. There is probably more fruits present but my limited tropical fruit palate cannot detect them. A little pop of bitterness at the end cleans the mouth out for the next sip. No alcohol and no heavy malt presence let the hops do their thing. Wonderful!
Wonderful stuff. Mango, guava and citrus. Some pine. Orange pour with good head and lacing. Good malt backbone. Bitter finish. Bottle from whole foods.

Âmbar alaranjado de média turbidez, espuma de boa formação e média persistência. Aroma mais intenso resinal e leve cítrico, caramelo, abacaxi maduro, maracujá. Paladar de médio amargor, leve dulçor. Corpo licoroso, baixa carbonataçao. Final resinal, amadeirado, dulçor caramelado. Muito bem equilibrada.
Goud oranje bier met een goede witte schuim kraag. Ruikt zoet, fruitig, tropisch. Smaakt vrij zoet, zoet fruit, honing.
UPDATED: APR 3, 2016 Mooie oranje kleur met een goede kraag. Ruikt fruitig, orange, honing. Smaakt fruitig, zoetig, honing, orange. Bitterzoete afdronk.

Bottle; pours cloudy orange gold with a white head; aroma of citrus fruits with malt and a hint of spice; taste has some light bitterness with more citrus, caramel, and some biscuit notes; finish is bitter; very nice beer

UPDATED: APR 11, 2017 Pours clear golden color, with stable foamy white head.
Visually medium carbonation.
Aroma: intense aroma of hops, which takes on pine, mango, pinneapple, grapefruit and tangerine, with malt aroma in the background, with biscuit and toffee like character.
Flavor: intense hop flavor, which takes on grapefruit, pinneapple, tangerine, oranges, mango and pine, which is perfectly balanced with malt flavor, with toffee like character. Malt sweetness is medium to moderate high, hop bitterness is high. 
Mouthfeel: as I said, the ingrediends are almost perfectly balanced, taste is firstly sweet, with bitter, slightly spicy, dry finish, which lingers long in aftertaste.
Body is medium, texture is silky soft, carbonation is medium. Alcohol warmth is obvious, but gentle.
Amazing!

Great honey-malt and earthy grapefruit hop aroma that is also slightly spicy. Cloudy burnt orange color with a soap colored tuft of foam. Tastes malty and earthy with a hop bite at the end that never turns bitter. Good smooth palate. Overall not as good as their winter version but still very good. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Sehr süßes DIPA, viel Mango, Papaya, wenig Bittere. ZUDEM grapefruit, Madarine. Insgesamt ein sehr überzeugendes DIPA, aber das Firetone Walker bleibt das bessere DIPA. Dennoch extrem süffig, zudem LECKER.
Bottle from Voldby. Pours golden/orange with a white head. Aroma and taste is malt, tropical fruits, grapefruit, citrus, orange peel, caramel. Soft carbonation. Nice fruity finish. Excellent.
Bomber to a pint. Hazy yellow gold with ample white head. Smells great, tropical fruit, floral and citrus notes... Flavors follow, balanced dry finish... Absolutely delicious DIPA...

Bottle from Voldby Købmandsgaard shared with the in-laws Hammel, DK - pours a nice vibrant orange colour with healthy medium sized white head and lacing. Aroma and taste is plethora of tropical fruits, big grapefruit, mango and peachy notes, a splash of citrus tangerine and lemon across the palate, tempered with a sweet caramel malty backbone, great brew this. Lovely.
Aromat chmielowy, zielona trawa i cytrusy. W smaku początkowa lekka biszkoptowa słodycz szybko przykrywana jest bardzo wysoką i zalegającą goryczką. Trawiaste i tytoniowe w posmaku. Niezbalansowane.

UPDATED: OCT 18, 2016 
Aroma:

Medium/heavy aroma of malts, caramel, honey, wood, vanilla  orange, hops, citrus, grapefruit and soap.

Appearance:

Turbid/opaque golden/amber beer with a slight/medium off-white head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium/heavy sweet with malts, caramel, honey, wood, vanilla and orange; ends slightly bitter and dry with hops, citrus, grapefruit and soap.

Overall

This beer is intense, complex and balanced. I must admit I have a really old one, bottled on 05/06/2014. Had three of these in total. This beer manages to be nothing less than amazing and age very well. A lot of malts, even some wood, vanilla and soap notes thanks to the aging. Probably missing a lot of hop flavours, but still manages to be so extremely complex. Amazingly opaque appearance with a steady and thick head. The palate is thick and totally soothes this beer. I can only imagine what a fresh one would taste like; especially considering I already like this one to a great extent.

Bottle from Bierkompass!

Pours slight hazy, golden orange with a small white head. Aroma has orange, grapefruit and sweet caramel. Taste is very fruity, lots of orange peel, citrus, grapefruit and some mango. Aftertaste has lots of sourish grapefruit and a slight caramel note, paired with orange and tropical fruit

APPEARANCE - Light, no head, hazy.

AROMA/SCENT - Hops, malts, yeast, floral, sweet.

TASTE - Hops, malts, yeast, sweet, nutty, caramel, brown sugar.

MOUTHFEEL/PALATE/TEXTURE - Smooth, a bit oily.

VALUE - $22 for a 22-oz bomber, way over bottle shop price.

OVERALL/DRINKABILITY - A bit boozy like a Tripel.

Pours fire yellow as we say in Sweden with a 2 finger white head..aroma; hoppy, citrus, honey, caramel and orange peels. Flavours; Rich hoppy tones with citrus, honey, caramel and some malt. A really nice creamy IPA!!
A classic, with a surprisingly hoppy maltiness for an SD IPA of this era. Really nice citrusy/resinous hop character, ofc.
Light orange body with a medium beige head. Aroma is very hoppy, grapefruit, citrus, caramel, malt. Taste is hoppy, heavy bitter and medium sweet. Hoppy aftertaste, full body.
Bottle from cervezalandia. Hazy dark gold color. Thin to medium white head. Medium bitterness, medium sweetness. Flavour is herby, hops, fruit, malt, grass, resin, spices, citrus, piney.

0.75l bottle. Courtesy of Lore, thanks for sharing. Slightly hazy golden body, lobg lasting white head. Aroma of biscuit, honey, hop resin, pine, peach and citruses. Taste of caramel, honey, pine, grass and grapefruit. Hoppy, but not aggressively bitter. At the same time sweet, but not cloying. Awesome beer.
Shared big bottle. Hazy golden colour. Hoppy malty caramel aroma and taste, with a bitter finish

Flaska boxbeer. Väldraget tefärg med fluffigt beiget skum. Starkt och kraftfull hunledoft. Barr, apelsin, grape och torkad frukt. Fyllig smak med tallskott och citrus. Hö och russin. Rejäl beska med lite värmande alkohol
Flaska från boxbeer. Bärnstenfärgad med vit skumkrona. Söt doft av humle, ananas och kola. Söt och lite besk kropp. Smak av rostad malt, bränt socker, torkad aprikos, tall och ananas.
Flaska från boxbeer. Ljust bärnstensfärgad med vitt skum. Kryddig humledoft med fin fruktighet. Söt och kryddig med balanserad beska.

Aroma verde, pieno di erba, leggermente resinoso e con diversi agrumi, leggerissimo nocciolo di pesca acerbo. Leggermente velata, giallo oro con schiuma bianca fine è persistente, allimbocco presenta un po  di frutta dolce, qualche pesca e una suggestione tropicale, agrumi e tanto amaro agrumato. Liscia al palato, abbastanza scorrevole e leggera ma mai acquosa. Buona, ottima, si lascia bere abbastanza bene

Pours two fingers of head on a hazy straw body.
The aroma is bright with tropical fruits: pineapple and mango.
The taste is moderate to strong bitterness right off the bat, then mellows to the end. A little sweet finish.
The texture is thicker.
Quite enjoyable.

The best dipa Ive ever had. And definitely one of the best beers overall one has ever tasted. Absolutely brilliant. Nice thick 2 finger head. Very versatile aroma and taste. This beer has everything. Would be interested to know, how much you have to pay for this in California. I paid 12,95 euros for this 0,65l bottle in Europe.

At first it starts as best DIPA I ever had.. after half of glass is gone, it becomes more common, but still very enjoyable. Quite intense maltiness, caramel, even bit honeyish, powerful hop combo gives peach, mango, grapefruit, lemon, pine.
Moderate sweetness with lasting bitterness and bittersweet finish. Feels very silky smooth and enjoyable.
Fantastic IPA, perfectly balanced! Well at the line of my expectations. Not stunned, price performance is way to high

Bottled 650ml. -from Za Popent Ljubljana. Unclear golden coloured, medium sized white to off-white head, sweet fruity hoppy nose. Moderate malty, caramel, quite fruity hoppy and slightly alcoholic with dry bitter sweet finish. Not so fresh version but still decent brew.

Aroma caramel, 
Appearance golden, hazy, white foam, 
Taste heavy cloying sweetness, medium bitterness, 
Palate full body, thick feel, average carbonation, 
Overall a full body refreshing summer beer that I would suggest to a friend
A: Light, one finger head. Lasting head. N: Pine, tropical fruits, mango, passion fruit T: Taste follows nose very well O: Very nice bitterness! Some sweetness in the back. Very nice!

Pours a slightly cloudy light amber, slightly darker than gold. World class head volume, lacing and retention.

Outstanding nose of citrus (tangerine, orange, light grapefruit) over a rich biscuit base. Underneath, is a tantalizing hint of spicy spruce.

Heavy light body with a fairly smooth texture. Superbly carbonated with a bit of effervescence in the middle and a rollicking fine effervescent prickly finish.

The outstanding flavor profile is almost world class. It begins with the citric flavors of the nose, but with more grapefruit rind present. The rind flows into spruce in the middle over a rising malt influence. A mild bitterness kicks in and the malts assume the forefront with a rich grainy biscuit sweetness. Surprisingly, caramel notes are present at a much higher level than the color would suggest. The finish delivers the expected alcohol burn at the back of the throat, but also allows the alcohol content to escape its previous flavor masking. A rind and pine like bitterness lingers along with the alcohol astringency.
Exceeded expectations greatly. Perfect balance of honey sweetness, piney resin and hoppy bitterness. Cant wait to seek out again next summer
Typical fantastic aroma from Ale Smith of tropical fruits and citrus. Mango lemon drop and tangerine. Light malty backbone makes it a great beer not just a hop tea like some. Clean hoppy finish.

On draft, Golden Crust, Red Lion, PA. served in a snifter glass. Pours orange gold, two finger off white head. Nice lacing and retention. Aroma of grapefruit and tangerine. Taste is assertively bitter balanced with caramel sweetness. Medium bodied, lively carbonation, resin but smooth mouth feel. Finishes long, dry and bitter. Tasting notes of red grapefruit, tangelos, spruce, caramel, resin and orange peel. Wow, I really enjoyed this offering! Very nice, punchy DIPA.

65cl bottle, served in Irish Pint. Pours golden orangish with a big white frothy head. Caramel aroma, citrus and tropical fruits. As for flavour, a lot of caramel with a slight fruity touch...fresh hops basically. Round on the palate. Full bodied, perfect carbonation. Nice, not outstanding though. At least once a year it is not a bad thing to have a fresh hop beer.

On tap. Pours a clear orange yellow with a nice thin head and laces well. Monster citrus nose, with oranges and grapefruit standing out to me. Very crisp attack, alcohol is hidden well, malts are present giving a bit of sweetness to the hop bitterness. long dry finish.

Flaska. Här pratar vi kvalitet. Vilka trevliga dofter av hav tång vått gräs samt toner av gödsel. Så jäkla balanserad o så alla smaker som man vill ha. Eftersmaken är något man vill ens barn ska uppleva.

Woow jävligt fräsch Dipa doft. Enormt komplex. Hav Gräs Äng. Smaken då??? Jo Krämig medelfruktig marsipan . Jävligt god fy Faaan. Lättdrucken å mjuk fyllig efterbeska . Trotts det hypade betygen hos ölnördar Så måste jag säga De eller Vi har rätt.
Tap. Citrus, pine, soap, grapefruit, herb, honey. Big IIPA but smooth. Full body with a great balance of syrupy sweetness, bitterness, carbonation and acidity. Long finish

Old bottle, aged almost a year. Aroma of tropical fruits, citrus, grapefruit, orange peel, malt, caramel, pine, floral notes, tea, hops. Flavour is moderate sweet with a long bitter finish. Thick and juicy. Massive DIPA. Hope to try a fresher bottle one day, it should be a lot better.

Flaska från Craftbeer/Galatea. Nästan ett år gammal. Smak och doft av humle, kolaremmar, karamell, torkad frukt. Rund och len, lagom sötma, fin balans mellan smakerna, beska med smak av grapefrukt, citrussskal och toner av tall. Mycket gott!

22oz bottle, from Dutchs. Mostly hazy golden orange color. Pours with a nice, bigger creamy thick white head. Leaves great, thicker lace. Fantastic big resiny citrusy and piney hop. Nice sort of biscuity bready malt, slightly cake-like. Medium to bigger body. Super-smooth, kind of creamy texture. Lightly slick. Lighter carbonation. Moderate to bigger bitter taste. Light to moderate sweet. Bit of a bigger malt component, but its not bothersome, pretty pleasant. Just a touch of a sweet, sort of yeasty bite at the end. Well balanced, tasty IPA. Very nice to enjoy with my sandwich.

Flaska från Craftbeer/Galatea. Nästan ett år gammal. Ändå väldigt bra även om humlen inte är på tårna. Istället får den rejäla maltkroppen mer fokus. Stora söta smaker av kolaremmar, karamell, apelsin, grape, tangerine, citrusmarmelad, karamellkok, kåda. Maffigt. Måttlig beska. Kanske är största problemet med åldern att beskan tonats ned och att det blir lite väl söt.

650ml bottle enjoyed @ my vacation apartment. Pours cloudy pale golden with a large white head. Aroma is citrus, tropical fruits, pine and grapefruit. Flavour is bittersweet. Full bodied, sticky texture, average carbonation. Finish is citrus. Very refreshing.

Bottle at home. Pours the usual light gold ipa color very light head. The aroma is all orange candy and a slight grassy note. The sweet malt flavor is nice accommodated by sugar covered oranges and tangerines that falls off instantly to a bitter palate cleansing finish. A delicious San Diego style Imperial IPA. Enjoy!!!!

Tap at the brewery. Half pint pour. Unfiltered golden orange with a nice frothy white head. Aroma is heavy on bright citrus primarily orange and grapefruit. Taste is incredibly smooth and has the well balanced flavors of the best double IPAs. Good bite and healthy alcohol kick. Citrus and tropical fruit are prevalent with the oily, piney hop resin featured in the aftertaste. Hard to beat this one. Very enjoyable.

Botella. @Cimmeria, Oviedo 23/05/2015 Bottle on: 03/05/14
Color ambar, aroma frutal, cuerpo medio, final amargo.

Pours deep golden with medium white head. Nose is honey and citrus. Aromas are toasted malts, grapefruit, raisin, pine and honey. Average carbonation, oily texture. Long bitter resinous finish. Amazing flavors.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle @ Shrewsbury Beer Share, Jan 15, courtesy of Simon or Paul. Pours hazy gold with white head. Lots of fruit reported with an amalgam of tropical fruit flavours lining up for duty. Exceptionally drinkable.

Hazy, orange beer with a three finger high, fluffy, whithe, head. A lot of lacing stays on the glass. 

Nose: Orange marmelade, apricot, pine, resin, grapefruit, pineapple, a lot of tropical fruit! Caramel malt and grass. 
Taste: Soft, smooth taste of orange, pine, resin, grapefruit and honey. 
Body: Full body. Thick and creamy. Complex structure. A great bitterness at the end. Medium to low, soft carbonation. 

This is an outstanding beer! Im so glad I got hold of this. Really good!

Kind of creamy honey smell. The taste has a body that combines with the hops to a sweetish taste. A little too bitter tart to be balanced. Aggressive feeling that stays in the aftertaste. Not that good.

On tap at the source. Cask. Pours a golden yellow with a thin white head. Aroma is tangerines and grapefruit. Delicious somewhat bitter. Finishes clean. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Hazy orange colour, white head. Aroma of tangerine, orange, caramel, grapefruit, hazelnuts and toffee. Light sweet, medium bitter, nutty and grapefruit flavour. Medium body, slick texture, average to fizzy carbonation. Dry finish.

04/29/14 bottle found cleaning out the fridge. Pours a clear golden colour with an ample, off white head that sticks to the class. Aroma has faded notes of resin, pine, caramel, citrus, and tropical fruits. Taste is balanced but on the sweeter side. Caramel, bread, citrus, pine, resin, and a drawn ing ending. Medium-full body with a low-medium carbonation. Resiny texture in the mouth with a dry finish. Im sure this was better fresh but it isnt half bad now.

shared bottle, poured a slight cloudy dark golden to orange colour with a white head, nose of pine hops, resin, malts, caramel sweetness, mango, peach, cut grass, grapefruit, orange, leaving into a moderate bitterness, dry aftertaste, slight oily mouthfeel. very enjoyable DIPA!

(AleSmith YuleSmith (Summer) India Pale Ale) Bottle 650 ml at home, served into a shaker, ABV 8.5%, bottled 5/6/14
Orange coloured body, a tad hazy, with one finger of thick and long lasting white head on top. Light lacing left around the glass.
Aroma of citrus, oranges, orange peel, cake.
Nice refreshing taste, very well hidden alcohol. Lots of oranges, tangerine, orange peel, some caramel malts, light grapefruit.
Medium body, good carbonation, mildly dry palate.
Great IPA.

Leicht trübe orangegoldene Farbe, ordentliche leicht beige Schaumkrone. Geruch sehr hopfig, kräftig malzig, reife Früchte. Geschmack sehr fruchtig hopfig, sehr herb, florale Noten, reife Citrusfrüchte.

Bottle. Copper orange. Pretty nice caramelly fruity aroma. Butterscotch, deep sweet pale caramels, citrus, orange zest, green berry bush. Marmelady. Full bodied, bitter, sweet oranges, green foresty piny finish. Easy smooth, not the lightest though.-- bb

Bomber bottled on: 05.06.14. Szkło: Teku. Po otwarciu butelki od razu pojawiają się piękne, intensywne cytrusowe i kwiatowe zapachy. Piwo barwy złotej, delikatnie opalizujące. Piana piękna, gęsta drobnopęcherzykowa nie chce opadać. Aromat jest cudowny, żywiczny, kwiatowy. Bardzo intensywny, jak na IIPA przystało. Doszukać w nim się mozna owoców cytrusowych takich jak grapefruit oraz tropikalnych - ananas! W smaku piwo jest juz troche ułożone, piłem je 7 miesięcy po zabutelkowaniu. Goryczka jest solidna i dobrze zbalansowana słodami. leciutko miodowe i jest wyczuwalny alkohol, co nie zaskakuje bo piwo ma jednak 8.5%. Bardzo dobre IIPA o fenomenalnym aromacie.

Bottle at tasting. Dark golden pour, white head. After popping the cap, a strong aroma of fruity hop and some malt fills the room. Delicious taste of bitter malt, some caramel, biscuit, pine, orange and grassy herbs. Not easy to drink, but very tasty.
Bottle (65 cl) from bierkompass.de. Clear golden, medium white head. Intense perfumy and piney hop aroma with some tropical fruits. Medium bodied, medium carbonation. Dry with high bitterness.
Bottle shared at home. Clear golden body with a medium white head. Taste is hops, pine, tropical fruits, grapefruit, l. Low - Medium carbonation.

UPDATED: APR 1, 2015 Bomber. Regalo de David de cervezorama. Color ambar melocoton espuma blanca de buena formacion y persistencia.Bizcocho,naranja, resina uva moscatel...textura aceitosa carbono media viva..buen equilibrio dulce amargo final resinado. Sabor potente!!! Birroterrrrr
Schade, leider alte Flasche. Alter Hopfen, Harzig, malzig, leicht fruchtig. Am Gaumen bitter, hopfig, Malzkörper ausgeprägt. Süffig, ok.

WYGLĄD: Barwa złota, opalizujące. Piana drobna, średniej wysokości, trwała i obfita. Ładny "lacing". 
AROMAT: Bardzo słodki aromat landrynki, ewentualnie multiwitamina, ale do rzeczy: karmelkowa ziołowość, aromat przypominający herbatę Earl Grey, tropikalne owoce (ananas, kokos, liczi, marakuja), słodkie cytrusy (pomelo, mandarynka, pomarańcz).
SMAK: Z początku świeży cytrusowy, choć bez specjalnej goryczki, a za chwilę karmelowo-ziołowy. Alkohol rozgrzewa przełyk, ale mógłby być nieco lepiej ukryty. Goryczka średnia do niskiej. Wysycenie średnie.
OGÓLNIE: Jest to piwo z gatunku tych, które przyciągają uwagę swoim aromatem. W smaku również mamy wszystko to, co powinniśmy spotkać w dobrym Imperial IPA. Na plus aromat, na minus słabo ukryty alkohol w smaku.

Thanks to John for sharing! Pours a pretty honey color with an off-white head. The smell is pine, toasted malt. The taste is pine, sweet malt, ending bitter and dry. The body is medium with nice fine carbonation.
Many thanks to John for sharing. Great floral but sweetish body. Fresh, easy to drink but you taste the alcohol. Bitter, malty, smooth but for me much too sweet.

Bottle, 650 ml from Whole Foods Bowery, New York. Pours unclear orange with off-white head. Strong fruit and citrus aroma. Caramel, tropical fruit, pine, citrus. Great fruity bitter finish. Balanced and refreshing.

Bottle at home. Hazy orange colour with white head leaving lots of lace. Stunning outlook. Aroma is lot of sweet fruit, sweet malts and some backround spruce. Taste is well balanced with malts and grapefruit bitterness with hint of alcohol in back. Almoust full bodied. Excellent beer.

0,65 l bottle from Bierkompass, bottled on 6/5/2014. Minimally hazy, golden orange with a huge, fine pored, foamy, stable, white head leaving some nice lacings on the glass. Very fruity aroma of grapefruit, lemon, orange, passion fruit and mango with honey, resin, pine and biscuits behind in the background. A little touch of alcohol is in there as well. Really intense, sweetish, citrusy taste with the honey, resin, pine and biscuits being more noticeable than in the aroma. The finish is not overly bitter or long, but with a sharp and peppery alcoholic note. Medium to full body, oily and creamy mouthfeel, average carbonation. Very good DIPA with a heavy, tropical nose and a satisfying taste and mouthfeel. Only the finish deserves some critics as I would have preferred less alcohol and more hop bitterness. Thats moaning on a very high level, though. Awesome beer!
floral, herbs, resin, amber, clear, frothy, white foam, medium bitterness, medium body, light body, thin feel, flat, long finish, bitter,
Bottle from saveur biere, france. Little hazy orange color, white head. Aroma is nice, sweet, fruits, hops. Balanced sweet body, fruity hops, grassy notes.
Semihazy tolden body, white fluffy head. Aroma has huge grapefuity aroma, oranges and caramel. Quite lot of pines in flavour. Huge beer and im quite speechless. Holy f** k.

22 oz bottle. Bottled 05/06/14. From saveur-biere.com.
Cloudy golden colour with a small to average size fluffy white head. 
The aroma is super intense hops with grapefruit, fruits, pine and orange... some sweetish malt and moderate bitterness. Wow! This kicks ass! 
The flavour is grapefruit, fruits, pine, moderate bitterness, sweetness and mild malt. Man... this is great! Absolutely amazing DIPA! Kill me now!
bottle. Golden with one finger head. Slightly boozy big IPA with medium body. Strong bitterness. Very well constructed.

Poured into a teku glass with a practically opaque dark honey brown with a clean but cloudy white heads. Bottled in May so Ive had this for over 7 months before opening. 

The nose shows very subtle but clean and refreshing tropical-fruits. Caramel malts seem to center stage here. Probably not so if fresh. 

The palate is medium bodied showing the same subtle but clean & refreshing tropical fruit juiciness with moderate carbonation. A very strong malt backbone supports the beer with the distinct IPA bitterness at the end. Probably would be amazing if poured fresh but still very good.

A light yellow, slightly orange coloured beer with a quite big and blond head. The nose has peaches, grapefruits, citrusfruits and some pine needles, slightly caramelly malts, hint of flowers, not totally fresh. Taste has storng caramel malts, not too sweet due to bitterness, grapefruits, some pine. Warming alcohol and hint of that is also noticed in the taste. Medium+ bodied, balanced to drink. This is good beer but still "wow" feeling is missing.

Bomber shared between five at the January 2015 Shrewsbury bottle exchange group meeting. Misty golden pour, white head. Tropical fruit nose and flavours, mango, peaches and apricots came to mind as I devoured my share of the beer. Very, very drinkable.

650ml bottle at the Hoppy Pub, Thessaloniki. Light hazy golden orange color with white head. Aroma is malty caramel and hoppy pine, light fruity. Sweet and bitter taste, caramel, tropical fruits, piney. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.
From the shared bottle. Past its prime. Still light lemon aroma and taste and very drinkable.

Bottle
Aroma-citrus, mango
Appearance-golden, hazy, white foam, 
Taste-medium bitterness, light sweetness, lightly sour, 
Palate-medium body, sticky, average carbonation, bitter finish
Overall-perfect

Sample at semi-S&G tasting (since the music was shut down halfway through).
APPEARANCE: clear blond beer, nice stable white head.
NOSE: pine, sweet, hoppy.
TASTE: pine, sweet, hoppy, nice, balanced.

bottle from Bierkompass. Hazy golden with a large white head. Full-bodied, intensive malty base with an alcoholic touch, quite warming. Lots of grassy and fruity hops, slightly piney, with mango and peach.

This has the expected strong resin, pine and spruce flavors, with just a little citrus (not sweet or juicy though). Well-balanced by bready, toasty malts. Drinkable for a very high IBU brew. Its good, but hard to distinguish from other good DIPAs. In fairness, my bottle was ~6 months old, so a fresh bottle might be even better.

65cl bottle from Erzbierschof. Pours in a slightly cloudy, yellowish orange color. The aroma is fruity, pointing at various aroma hops. The taste confirms these suspicions: It is indeed very fresh, fruity, combined with just the right amount of bitterness. An outstanding beer indeed.

0,65 l bottle from Biervana 
resin, spruce, citrus, cereal, golden, cloudy, frothy, white foam, light sweetness, very bitter, medium body, oily feel, slick feel, average carbonation, long finish, bitter,
22oz in Seattle. Good body, copper malts. Hops are rich but sitting behind. Will have to try this again fresher.

Its almost winter but why not taste AleSmiths famed summer IPA... Pours a pale orange with somewhat ochre hue, clear but hazy with deposit and with vivid sparkling, under a thick, clearly hops-enhanced, lacing, egg-white, moussy head with surprisingly good retention seen the ABV. Powerful earthy, spicy and citrussy aroma of grapefruit, pine needles, orange peel, red apple, dried ginger, black pepper, nutmeg, wormwood, tonic water, old cheese, fried chicken, cigarette tobacco, lavender soap, bourbon, bark, mango, papaja, paprika, meat broth, strawberry... One of those luxurious ales with an aroma so complex I could sniff it for hours. In the mouth, an explosion of exotic, spicy and sweet fruits, supported by an utterly refreshing and cleansing citrussy sourishness and spiciness, medium strong, minerally and slightly sourish carbonation, resinous mouthfeel, then making way for a deep, smooth caramelly and nutty maltiness overcome by the expected strong, dry and extremely long hop bitterness, earthy, leafy, peppery, cheesy, citrussy and so complex, but still remaining elegant and not too corrosive; retronasal, almost liquorice-like spiciness and some warming alcohol is present in the background but only for structure and not obnoxious at all. One of the greatest IPAs I had so far, so satisfying, quenching and refreshing... "California dreaming" on a cold, windy and dark winter night. Wonderful!

UPDATED: MAY 11, 2015 Orange color with medium head. Grapefruit, and heavy aroma of pines and resins, honey, nuts. Taste is resinous, sweet, but not overpowering. Sweet oranges. Tangerine in the finish that lingers. The bitterness fits in perfectly. Perfectly balanced!

Great, great, great american beer. Awesome aroma, a lot of citrusy, hops, grapefruit. Great taste, dry with high short bitterness. Very drinkable. Beautiful white head, nice lacing. Brilliant beer. If youre hop head - youll love this beer.

Tres belle IPA double de chez alesmith. Bien houblonnée, avec des notes dagrume, orange, caramel ou miel et une belle amertume qui donne une bonne longueur en bouche. Texture légèrement huileuse et résineuse, le tout un peu épicé et assez bien équilibré.

Aroma: intense caramel malts, overripe fruit. Appearance: hazy, pale gold, medium, frothy, white head. Taste: light sweet. Palate: intense sweets, grain and caramel malts, ripe fruits again, some alcohol. Overall: very nice, great aroma and palate. Bottle from the brewery, San Diego.

Rating #1000.
Couleur dorée orangée, beau col blanc. Super nez houblonné amer avec note douce fruitée, orange et raisins, puis pin et écorce sèche. Gout amer agrumes, orange, puis pin résineux et  houblon gras avec beaucoup de douceur et rondeur en bouche. Bière onctueuse, bien balancée avec fin résineuse , bon houblon amer et note épicée, fruitée orange/agrumes, caramalt,  très longue et intense. Géniale!
Peut etre pas si complexe, mais vraiment intense. Nickel!

Clear deep golden with a fluffy thick white head. Gorgeous nose of light floral pine notes and freshly cleaned hotel room with a wee bit of orange zest. The flavor is big and bold with a large orangey bitterness with lots of floral resins and pine notes, but theres also this wonderful toffee and caramalt boozy backbone. Its a striking balance thats both super hoppy and bitter but also super malty. I think theres a wee bit of spruce in there as well. Lovely hop flavors of floral resins and fresh picked leafy earthy hops and citrus rind, followed by a lot of caratoffee.

Bottle @ ZZT X, courtesy of dEnk. Pours a clear dark golden beer with a big white head on top. Aroma is pine resin, grapefruit, citric hops, light grassy notes, alcholic influences. Flavor is very bitter, loads of West Coast hops are present here, like liquid rays of sun in a glass. Great stuff to drink in the summer, too bad its winter right now. Long bitter and refreshing aftertaste, medium carbonation. Awesome beer, great stuff.
Bottle @ ZZT 10 shared by dEnk. Slightly hazy golden colour with a small to medium sized white head. Smells hops, pine, resin. Tastes hops, tea, pine, resin. Medium body, soft carbo.
Bottle @zzt10 shared by dEnk. Golden color with a small white head. Smells and tastes hoppy, some malts, pine, citra, grapefruit.

Fresh hops floral, grapefruit, very well developed. Delicious soft yet present bitterness, so well made. Totally American, in the best of ways. Juicy mouth feel, super drinkable. I expected much and still got impressed. (Bottle gifted by Menno and John, many thanks!)
22oz bottle. Golden with one finger head. Citrus and slight pine aroma. Powerful grapefruit and biscuit taste. A very solid beer that hides the alcohol.
11/1/2014. 22 oz. bottle. Hazy amber with a large white head. Dried spice aromas, hops, citrus, pine and malt. This is a fantastic DIPA, nice balance, complex, bitter all the way. Outstanding beer.

Bottle from Voldby. Bronze pour with a huge frothy head. Nose has caramel, pine, some exotic fruits. Taste is pretty dull at first but as it warms up theres an explosion of caramel, mangoes, grapefruit and biscuits. Tasty stuff!

Bottle from Beers of Europe. Hazy gold with nice foamy white head. Aroma of citrus hops, pine, grapefruit, juicy fruit. Lovely taste reflecting the same elements, juicy, bitter, dry, great full mouthfeel, long bitter finish. Excellent.

Bottle from Rattle n Hum. Pours hazy orange with firm white head. Nose shows lots of citrus, some pine and also grapefruit. Taste is fresh and bitter. Juicy grapefruit and citrus dominate. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle pour avg gold with thick white head. Nose pine, resin, dried fruit. Taste moderate bitter up front, then lots of dank hop. Mid palate light sweet then light grainy malt. Longer bitter finish. Too bad the nose doesnt carry though in the flavor.
Bottle at home. Pours golden, nose is citrus, floral, taste is similar, juicy, bitter.

Bottle from the Kaapse bottleshop ( NL ) . 
Bottled 05 06 14 . 
Pours unclear yellow/amber , good white head . Smell is sweet, caramely grains . Bit hops ( amarillo ?? ) . 
Taste is nice and refreshing, hoparoma, sweet maltyness , fruity , corns , bitter . Very nice, malty IIPA . Love it !

From bomber. Pours a dark golden with a white head. Overflowed on opening. Big pine citrus aroma with a similar taste. Notably bitter. Dry. Bitter finish. Nice flavor, but would prefer a little more sweetness.
Bottle at home. Hazy orange pour, thick white head. Aroma is full of fresh citrus, pine, resin, grapefruit and floral hops. Flavor is bitter and full on fresh hops. Great IPA.
UPDATED: OCT 13, 2016 Botella de 65 cl, adquirida en tienda XXXII. Color dorado. Sabor a lupulo, afrutado, ligeramente a malta, resinoso, citrico. Una IPA extraordinaria.

darker golden colour, huge, yellowish, creamy head, which lasts for several minutes; marvellous aroma of resiny-citrusy-tropical fruity hops and some biscuit; brilliant bittersweet taste with pine resin, intensive tropical fruits, maltyness and some spicy alcohol - surprisingly intensive malty sweetness can be felt first (together with of course the hops), which hand over the place to the devastating bitterness; amazing IIPA! Who am I to find even a slight mistake in it!?

1 pint/6 ounces/66 cl?, flaske, 8,5 % ABV, købt i Barley Wine i CPH City, 3. oktober 2014.
Orange/gylden og ufiltreret amerikansk dIPA med højt fint-boblende skum på 6-7 cm. 
Øllets delikate aroma rummer humle, blomst, citrus, alkohol, appelsin, gran og skunky. 
Smagen er virkelig intens med en fantastisk balance mellem sødme og bitterhed. Masser af krop og dybde. Smagen er meget homogen, men slutter ekstra bittert af, hvor vi lige strejfer det beske i bitterhumlen. 
Virkelig rar mundfølelse med en fin karbonering under medium, og alligevel frisk nok til at holde sanserne og svælget tændt. God lang eftersmag trods det bratte og halvtørre i ganen og svælget. 
Min 2. smagning af denne øl, og glæden ved at bedømme den er bare endnu større denne gang - en stor nydelse!

Bottle @ home. Aroma is huge fruity piney hops, orange, citrus, cedar, pine, big caramel and more. Flavour is zesty fruity hops, quite bitter, orange, mango, citrus, hint of cedar and huge caramel. Very nice!

"bitter orange is the story here. in the nose and in the flavor. not that well balanced, whixh is quite alright with me. for now, i actually like their ipa (my favorite at 4.5) and the winter yulesmith better, but ive had those fresh, and this beer was brewed for july and sampled 11/4. Fresh, gotta bump it up a tenth. Great brew."
Extremely well balanced. Perfect body, carbonatation and palate. No excessive bitterness, malts or citrous. Uau!

Pour is clear golden orange with thin pale head. Aroma is grassy and earthy with some light citrus notes. A light caramel-chocolate note comes with the sweetness of the malts. Taste is resinous bitterness with light chocolate notes. Some citrussy flavors too. Good DIPA!

Butelka 66cl. 
OCZY : piwo ma kolor jasnej pomarańczy, jest delikatnie zamglone z widocznymi bąbelkami. Piana piwa jest duża o kolorze białym. 

NOS : piwo ma dominujące nuty skórki cytryny, żywicy, tarty i alkoholu. Po wstrząśnięciu cierpkie nuty skórki cytrusów się wyostrzają. Ogólnie aromaty są intensywne ale bez większych komplikacji. 

USTA : piwo ma zaskakująco mocne nasycenie jak na "amerykana". Tłuste o konsystencji pełnego mleka. 
Piwo jest intensywne. Nuty słodowe zapewniają solidne tło dla całkiem mocnych estrów, cierpkich nutek skórek cytrusów. Żywica i alkohol potęgują uczucie gorzkości, która umiarkowanie zalega. Posmak jest gorzki i cierpki. 

ODCZUCIA : przyzwyczaiłem się, że piwa tego browaru są referencją w każdym stylu. Można by powiedzieć szlachetne. Jeszcze nie piłem przeciętnego piwa od AleSmith. Ta IIPA nie jest najlepszą jaka piłem ale pomiędzy całą resztą pretendentów o tytuł króla tego stylu, ta przynajmniej uchowała swój specyficzny, cierpki i estrowy charakter. Super.

OCENA : 
smak : 8/10
pijalność : 7/10
styl : +2

Bittle from Chuckaduck, thanks again man! Amber pour with a white head. Big aromas of citrus and resinous hops. Flavor is tropical fruit hops balanced with just the right amount of malty sweetness. Another delicious beer from alesmith.

Bottle from Drankenhandel Deconinck, Vichte. Amber colour, white foam. Medium carbonation. Very fruity aroma of tropical fruit (citrus, lemon, passion fruit, mango). Juicy character. Sweet with very bitter hoppy finish. Very well balanced. Very good!

UPDATED: OCT 31, 2014 Bottle from Bierkompass.de. Dark golden to amber, clear body, with a big, creamy, slightly beige head, that leaves a lot of lacing. Lovely aroma of pine, grapefruit, lots of tropical fruits, peach, biscuit, honey, slight alcohol. Taste with about the same aromas, also some nice tea notes and suprisingly smooth. Mouthfeel is medium, slick, with a medium carbonation and it finishes pretty smooth, medium bitter, dry, with lemon zest, pine, fruit notes and also some sweet malts. Overall just amazing how smooth this is for an Imperial IPA! Perfect balance, lovely and complex hop notes and with a delicious, smooth malt backbone. Close to a perfect DIPA and completely worth the high ratings!
So this is awesome. Pours a sunny orange with sticky lacing. Aromas are citrus and tropical fruit and sweet malts. Flavors are sweet and malty with a nice citrus hop finish. A really good beverage.

Clear amber color with rich white foam. Bottle conditioned. Hoppy aroma, very fruity, with grapefruits, orange and pineapple, and sweet malts on the background as well. Taste is very hoppy, full of flavour, with tropical fruits, sweet malts and a bit of pine and resin. Bitter aftertaste, dry finish. Really nice Double IPA.

Look: pours a bright orange. White head. Ver clear.
Smell: citrus fruit. Tangerines. Oranges. Very hop forward. Tropical fruits.
Taste: tangerines. Lemons. Orange peel.
Feel: very dry. Nice IIPA. Medium carbonation.
Overall: good beer. Love the aroma. Wish the taste had more tropical fruit not just citrus.
First drank: home 9/1/14
Clear beer, surprisingly--good lacing, stable head. More bitter than aromatic, lacks malt backbone, theres plenty of strength though. Good tasty beer, but a little underwhelming given the hype.

Bottle (22 Oz): pours somewhat cloud golden. Nice white head that diapers. Nice lacing. Smells and tastes of grapefruit. Hops. A little bitterness in the end. Bottled nearly 4 months ago so may not be the freshest

bottle shared with JC A: grapefruit, orange/tangerine, some caramel App: clear copper thick white head t/p: full body with long bitter finish. velvety texture o: excellent. the sweetness of this beer sits on a bed of delicious hops. interesting from the first to the last sip
Bottle. Pours a transparent amber with a thin layer of cream colored head. Aroma of malts and hops. Taste of citrus and bitterness and malts. A nice balance.

From a bottle just over 3 months old. Would like to find a fresher sample next May/June. Pours a hazy light copper with lasting white head and great lacing. Aroma is fruity, floral, and herbal. Taste is malt-balanced at first, getting more assertively bitter with grapefruit in the end. Sweet and herbal aftertaste, and comes across overall as a spiced IPA. This is solid overall, even if its not my ideal IPA flavor profile  This must be better fresh to be a Top 20 Double IPA.   Its good, but not outstanding.

Pours a hazy golden with a pillowy head which disappears in good time, lacing the glass the entire way.....aroma is sweet malt, piney, citrus near grapefruit......taste is well carbonated with a solid mouthfeel with grapefruit, sweet malt, slightly earthy and tailing off with slight metallic taste. Slight oiliness on the lips, which is not terribly desirable.....all in all a well built double.

Color dorado diáfano con densa espuma blanca. Aromas de frutales intensos, toques herbales suaves. Cuerpo medio, inicio dulce y afrutado, seguido de un amargor complejo entre fruta, hierba y resinas, muy equilibrado. Excelente.

Bottle.

Head is initially large, frothy, white, mostly diminishing.
Body is dark yellow to light amber.

Aroma is lightly malty (toasted grain), lightly to moderately hoppy (resin, grapefruit), with notes of cardboard and alcohol.

Flavor is moderately to heavily sweet, lightly to moderately acidic, lightly to moderately bitter.
Finish is lightly to moderately sweet, lightly to moderately acidic, moderately to heavily bitter.

Medium to full body, watery texture, lively carbonation, moderately to heavily alcoholic, moderately astringent.

Alesmith has long had issues with premature oxidation, and this is a good, recent example of that...this only hit shelves in the last month or two, but is already noticeably papery. There are still some hops apparent, but not much, and they are the basic resinous-grapefruity variety. Theres really not much else going on here. Abrasive and caustic in the mouth...astringent and unbalanced. A below average example of the style by anyones measure.

Bottle-poured golden color with huge white head. Aroma-WOW!!, fresh piney hops, its xmas in july! Taste is sweet and spicey. Has lemony/pine up front with excellent sweet malt on palate with mildly biiter finish. Mouthfeel is perfect, smooth with nice carbonation. Overall an excellent beer. Reminds me more of a regular ipa and not a double. Not sure ibus but cant be over 100.

Bottle. Pale amber with a white head. Aroma is earthy and spicy with grapefruit and pine, a surprising vanilla tone. Medium bodied, carbonation is highish, a little higher than Id like. Not very sweet with fairly plain pale malty flavours, no caramel. Lots of citrus flavours, earthy and a little peppery at the end. Spices go well there with the dry and firmly bitter finish. No great depth to it, but that dry, almost stern finish more than makes up for it. Would be better for summer, but the seasons dont work that way.

My recommendation is to try this a couple times... In various social settings. Perhaps its the name and a self fulfilling prophecy, but the beer takes on the "holiday" you enjoy it in. Whether its a holiday in the summer with neighbors and side walk chalk or an obscure bicentennial celebrating the birth of unicycles, the enjoyment factor directly hinges on your commitment to the festivities. First time trying it... I was invested with great friends and a monumental night. Second time... Same great friends and a great time... But the beer lost its superiority. An original 4.7 was taken down to a 3.8. So to this I say... Tis the season... sometimes. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Starts with fresh citrus, grapefruit and tangerines. Taste follows with the same and a bit more smooth bitterness. Finish is long lasting and clean.

A nice orange color with a two finger off white head. Aroma is citrus, piney, some tropical fruits and a slight sweetness. Taste is citrus and piney with a hint of alcohol in the end. A good one.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle picked up from Julios in MA. Pour was pale golden, good head and excellent lacing. Bready aroma with some citrus. This is really malty, yet not heavy and a moderate hop backbone. Hops are a complex blend of citrus, resin and earthiness. Fairly well balanced. Havent had the winter version recently enough to compare. :( Another enjoyable brew from AleSmith.

Bomber. Pours a beautiful golden color. Thick, dense, pillowy head leaves some substantial lacing. Aromas of grapefruit and pine resin abound. Taste follows with pine resin and grapefruit showing heavily. A bit sweet with the malt, but the lingering bitterness makes up for that. Medium body with a dry bitter finsh. Just a bit of alcohol making its presence known. Hop forward West Coast DIPA.
user_location: Menasha Red Light District, Wisconsin, USA

text: Bomber packaged 05/01/14. Must try fresher some time and re-rate, cuz yeah, this be oxidized. It also has diacetyl. Dammit! Pours clear amber with a frothy white head. Appearance is absolutely beautiful. Can tell it used to be hoppy, but all thats left is some bitter cardboard. And butter. The hops may have covered up the diacetyl when it was fresh, but now its very apparent. Not too happy right now.

22oz bottle from Downer Wine and Spirits. Pours a clear amber color with a big white head and some lacing. Aroma is hoppy, orange, tangerine, some pine. Medium on the palate with soft carbonation. Flavor is sweet, malty, bread, nutty, bitter pine hops, some grapefruit, with a dry, bitter finish. Very nice.

Pours a light golden-yellow, with middling head. Aroma is very sweet-- bready, malty, fruity. Flavor has a ton of bitter, piney hops in the forefront, with citrus flavors, bready/malty sweetness and a touch of alcohol/booziness. Very nice DIPA.

Pale amber with rocky off-white head. Nose is hot with meaty orange citrus, grapfruit and pine. Flavor is deep orange and grapefruit bitterness with pine to round it out. Sticky malt backing match. Alcohol is a bit noticeable and detracts a bit in combination with the strong bitterness. Overall, still a solid brew.
Imported from untappd iphone. comes as close to my memory as possible. Tap at ridgewood
Bottle. Pours orange with white head. Aroma is strong citrus, very very hoppy. Taste is very piney and citrusy, resinous, thick and flavorful. A really delicious beer!

22 oz bottle, bottled on 5/1/14. Pours clear golden orange with a huge frothy white head that retains well and laces the glass.

The aroma is sweet sugary fruits and some resiny piney peppery hops.

The flavor is sweet bready malts with some fruit and a big piney, resiny hop bitterness that lingers in the finish. The mouthfeel is medium to full bodied with smooth carbonation.

Overall, a solid DIPA. I remember liking the winter version better.

A moderate light orange liquid topped with a respectable but soft, off-white head. Aroma is grapefruit, sweet oranges (wow!) and pine resin. Malt does not override the hops, but makes it terribly sweet and easy to swill. Be careful of this one! The moderate bitterness clings for only a short while but the underlying malty sweetness is a little cloying for me. Loved it cold, am liking it less as it warms. Still a very good brew, but not staying with me.

Very bitter DIPA, goes down easy, one of the lighter dipas i have had, you definitely feel the alcohol but dont taste it, could have a little more complexity to it, still a very good beer but not as good as I remembered, maybe tastes have changed.
Small hop aroma, golden color, lighter hop taste than I usually prefer, but overall a very good summer IPA.

Bottle. Clear goldish copper. Malty candied aroma with biscuit. The taste adds a hint of chocolate and wood. Very off in a great way. Complex and interesting. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Clear gold with a thin white head. Aroma is super sweet. Melted Jolly Ranchers and light floral notes. Taste adds caramel and light booziness. Sticky mouthfeel and light carb. Nice.

Pint on tap. Clear burnt orange with a lasting ring of foam. Nose of evergreen resin, orange zest, green herb and caramel. Tastes of caramel, resin, herb and peppery citrus zest. Light-medium body has medium-high carbonation and a dry finish.

651 ml.bottle. Bottled 05/01/14. Pours a medium to thick, well retained, off white head, with extensive lacing, over a clear amber (SRM 14) body.....nose is pine, resin, grapefruit peel, hints of sweet malts with light toffee/caramel, no esters, balance to the hops.....taste is resin, pine to start, then citrus notes (lemon, grapefruit), licorice notes, light sweet toffee/caramel malts, finishing with a moderate bitterness, no esters, balance to the hops......mouth feel, medium body, slightly sticky, alcohol warmth present, mildly astringent, carbonation adds tingle and light acid. This is clean, crisp and refreshing and definitely a "West Coast"  I/DIPA. It is a bit unbalanced towards the hops with some ever so slight numbing effects from that backbone. Think a very slight effect similar to Schezwan peppercorns. A bit of an increase in the malt backbone would improve it.  BJCP 8/3/14/4/7

Bottle from Brewdog online. This is about a year old, but being 8.5% should still be very drinkable. Colour is cloudy slightly rusty amber, thin white foam head. Nose is caramel and toffee, hard green leafy hops, slight musty oxidisation, pine, orange citrous. Taste is dry bitter green leafy hops, slight oxidisation and yeast extract saltiness, caramel and barley sugar sweetness, slight nutmeg spiciness, grapefruit and orange citrous.

Bottle thanks to Jeff. Pours a clear orange with small frothy white head. The aroma is tangerine, grapefruit, and pine. Sticky mouthfeel with nice grapefruit, pine, light bitterness, really enjoyed this one.

Pours a golden color with a thick white head. Citrus, hop, pine, caramel, biscuit, honey and malt aroma. Mango, orange, grapefruit, tangerine, hop, honey, resin, pine, caramel, biscuit, malt and slight alcohol flavors. Medium body and carbonation with good bitterness. Citrus, malt and slight alcohol finish.

Bottle. A beautiful beer. Clear medium orange golden. Great big frothy white head, fully lasting leaving lots of lace. Aroma bursts from the glass. Fruity and spicy and moderately mslty. Citrus. Tropical. Pine. Caramel. Quite spiciness. Bigger medium body. Flavor matches aroma. Moderate bitterness that doesnt overstay its welcome. Great balance. Very smooth with great drinkability for a DIPA. Very good.
Very hoppy, yeasty, citrus/fruit aroma. Taste is similar, very strong, bold, smooth, and captivating. Very well blended.
