Huge tropical nose that goes on and on. Creamy mouthfeel that sticks to your tongue. Hoppy bitterness up front, then rounds out at the end. Beautiful balance between Carmel malts and hoppy resin. A great summer...no, anytime beer!

UPDATED: AUG 14, 2014 Running for the best IPA I have had, and up there with Blind Pig, Enjoy By, the Alpine and Kern River stuff... etc. Delightful: inredibly fresh, piney yet tropical notes. Huge hop bouquet. Mouthfeel is intense, tons of hop bitterness, a slight booziness, and mostly a dry mouthfeel. Finish is dry, with more lingering hop bitterness. This is just fantastic stuff. Big tropical notes as well. It reminds me of a better version of Racer X by Bear Republic; an absolute treat of an IPA.

Bottle. Light golden. Aroma is lemon citrus. Taste is grapefruit to the max, acid, resin. Overall, this one definitely grew on me as it went along, though the grapefruit flavour profile is not how I love my IPAs. Definitely well made and tasty.

Tap pour @Covenhoven. Semi cloudy dark orange in glass. Thin head. Irregular lacing. Lush spruce and grapefruit nose. Chessman cookies. Taste is pine resin, orange bitters, and a reserved malt backing. Some tropical fruit on progression. Warm finish. Sticks too the gums. Nice round flavors. Glad I got to try this fresh.

On tap at Ridgewood (Raleigh). 

Pours a nice amber. Sweet aroma. Hops in the taste, but not powerful. Pretty good summer beer (best summer beer with "Yule" I've ever had). 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Pours a mostly clear amber color with a moderate off-white head on it. Nose is nice and hoppy, with some nice grass and resiny elements coming off it. Taste seems a little bitter up front, but has a slightly sticky sweetness to it. Really quite a decent beer.

One of my most looked forward to beers each year. Pours perfect orange, with thick white head. Piney citrus on the nose. Very dry, with tons of thick, dank pine hops and a citrus back. Just a great SoCal double IPA

Clear golden orange with a three-finger off-white head that dissipated slowly and left exquisite lace. Rich aromas of citrus and pine hops accompanied by mild spice and caramel malt. Hop bitterness up front - citrus and very nice pine - supported by a moderate but strong malt foundation, but the hops never back down. Medium body and carbonation, creamy mouthfeel, and a rich bitter finish.

650 ml bottle from Premier Gourmet. Pours a fairly clear golden colour with lasting white head. Aroma is full of spicy hops, some subtler tropical fruit and caramel malt. Flavour has big spicy hoppiness, some resin and tangerine notes, solid caramel malt backbone and a little alcohol. Body verges on full. Nice IIPA.
Poured from bottle. Slightly hazy yellow color. Citrusy hops aroma. Caramel malts in flavor, grapefruit zest. Well ballanced sweetnes and bitterness.

Bottle. Aroma is clean American style, hoppy. Citrusy resiny, lightly woody. Bright golden colour. Taste is initially nice smooth honeyish caramel malty. The hoppy bitterness is intensive, but not unpleasant. Pineapple, grapefruit, orange. Full bodied, higher carbonation. Long dry hoppy finish. Very good intensive IPA.

Bottle. Hazy orange yellow color with thick white head. Strong hoppy aroma with tangerines, orange zest, malt. Solid malty base followed by fruity hops together with oranges, tangerines, orange zest. Long hoppy bitter finish. Tasty.

Bottle at Behind the hills beer tasting 2014. Pours golden color, white head. Aroma is sweet, floral hops, grapefruit, pine, tangerines. Taste is bitter, lightly sweet, hints of alcohol, grapefruit, tangerines. Nice bittersweet finish.
Flaska. Zlata farba, pekna biela pena. Prijemna ovocna vona, v pozadi citit citrusovy chmel. Vyvazene telo. V chuti citit alkohol, ktory je hned neutralizovany prijemnou horkostou.

For an Imperial IPA, YuleSmith was surprisingly sweet. Granted, the bottle I drank from had a fair amount of age on it, and the hop bitterness had been completely muted. The hop notes hinted at tangerine and berry. The big, sweet malt backbone is what really caught my attention. It provided a whole lot of caramel flavor and aroma. While Id like to try a fresher batch for comparison, YuleSmith made an impression by being one of the most palatable Imperial IPAs Ive ever tried.

(Thanks Chris "Budznsudz") 

Bottle.

A- Caramel, Butterscotch, citrus, bread.

A- Dark yellow color, super cloudy liquid, minimal head.

T- Caramel, slight bitterness, citrus, anise, licorice.

P- Medium body, average texture, little carbonation, spiced finish.

O- You could tell it had some age on it as there was virtually no head to a beer that was suppose to be super heady. The flavors and aromas were crazy. Lots of caramels mixed with fruits, and some anise notes towards the finish. Pretty complex and a solid beer.
Golden with large head. Very flowery aroma and taste. Grainy, dry bitter finish.

Tasted from bottle. Pours a hazy straw yellow with nice white head. Lots of lacing. Excellent citrus aroma. Taste is grapefruit, orange, spices with hints of caramel and pine. Supremely well balanced for a double IPA with excellent bitter taste. Medium bodied with a carbonated, crisp mouthfeel. Great IPA. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle at good attitude beer shop in Mendrisio
Wonderful double IPA. As they told me, it has a big problem...makes you sleep after one glass!
A lot of hops, little bit winey and very alcoholic.

Bottle @Man in the Moon, Stockholm. Pours an almost clear light amber with a fairly large frothy white head. Aroma is grapefruit, peach, apricot, pine, resin, dew grass. Taste is grapefruit, honey, resin, peach, apricot, orange, caramel, pine. Mouthfeel is somewhat carbonated and a bit coarse, but not unpleasantly so. Aftertaste is pine, grapefruit and perfectly balanced hop bitterness. Just great!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

66cl Bottle, thanks Gideon! Its actually called YuleSmith Summer Holiday Ale (nowadays?). Clear golden orange colour, white head. Aroma of strawberry jam, pine, grapefruit, citrus, caramel. Flavour is medium-sweet, light-malty, hint of toast, caramel, pine, grass, grapefruit, citrus, decent hoppy pine bitter finish with some resin. Medium-bodied. The beer was a bit old I guess, but still quite nice.

Couleur or, peu de mousse. Nez puissant, houblonné, agrumes, pamplemousse, mandarine, très frais. Bouche très puissante, sèche, un peu résineuse, pleine dagrumes, fruits exotiques (mandarine, pamplemousse surtout, un peu de mangue) quelques notes florales aussi (violette ?). Finale très longue, sèche, grosse amertume. Double IPA assez originale, elle na pas le côté caramel et sucre des Double IPA, on est vraiment sur le fruit mais avec une très grosse puissance.
Straw colored pour. Nose of citrus witty a tinge of sweetness. Taste is interesting. I cant put a finger on the subtle flavor that you dont see in IPAs. Different and very good at same time.
Has an aroma that is full of citrus, particularly grapefruit and hops. Taste is similar but very crisp and refreshing. Tastes like I waited a little too long to drink it but still very good.

Aroma: orange, coriander, some pear, bready yeast. Appearance: light gold.ivory white and creamy head. haphazard lacing. medium amount of carb bubbles. Taste: bitter orange peel, sweet citrus, and spicy peppercorn notes. Palate:creamy texture with average carb. finishes bitter and spicy, but clean. aftertaste doesnt linger.

Bottled May 24, 2013 pours clear yellow gold with tall bubbly foam. The aroma is nice citrus grapefruit orange with a crisp earthy floral tint. The taste is very good, taste is strong on alcohol for 8.5% but it becomes welcoming and warming with the abundant hops that go with the fuel. Very smooth blend of several hops giving a fast round hop feel of orange peel, grapefruit, and earthy herbal hop that is brought out bigger with some pine by the lightly sharp carbonation. Nice rich brew, dry finish.

Pour is a clear golden color with a decent white head. Smells of cat piss, malty sweetness and light alcohol. Taste is like grapefruit, little sweet, and caramel malt. Good carbonation, again cant really tell when this was fresh.

Pours a mostly clear amber colour with a creamy off white head. Aroma is of caramel malts, floral hops, pine, and citrus fruits. Taste is slightly sweet but quite bitter throughout, nice balance. Medium body, smooth on the palate, and lively carbonation. Overall an awesome brew.

Poured from the bottle. Color is golden yellow with nice white head. Aroma is matly sweetness and pine hops. Flavor follows with a balance of hops and malt sweetness. Hops linger only a bit, then fade away. Very nice IPA.
Bottle pour a few months back. What stuck out about this brew were the well balanced orange, grapefruit and citrus flavors. AleSmith does it again!

Fucken bomber @ home, courtesy of womencantsail, a fine sailor and a connoisseur of 1oz beer tasters. Cheers Until Next Time! Pours a fairly clear, golden orange appearance with a cream colored head. Toasted malty, a bit hot, somewhat spicy, herbal, somewhat bready, tangerine/orange fruity hoppy aroma. A bit goopy malty flavor on the tongue. Somewhat bitter, bready, chewy, herbal, pineapple/orange fruity hoppy flavor. Ok. Probably could be a bit more fresh but glad to have finally tried this.

Nice citrus floral hop aroma. Quite pleasant. Some piney hop aroma in there as well. Well balanced and full flavored. Maybe a bit on the sweet side, but not overly sweet. Taste has some of the piney bitter finish but not as much as the ale smith ipa. Sweetness may overpower the floral and citrus hop flavor? ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Got one of the first pints off the hand pump tap at Toronado.

Pours a light straw with a ton of lacing and head.

Smell consists of heaping quantities of pineapple and other tropical fruits. Taste contains a lot of the same with some citrus thrown in as well. Not a lot of malt to this one.

Carbonation was medium-low and this is a very easy drinking beer especially for the relatively high ABV the alcohol is masked quite efficiently.

Bottle. Pours a nice golden yellow with an off-white head. Aroma is a big hop bomb! Fresh grapefruit, pine, citrus and faint malt. Taste is bitter hops, grapefruit juice, citrus and pine. Very balance IPA that is refreshing and smooth finishing.

Pours a beautiful clear golden color with a clean white head that leaves heavy lacing. Aromas of grapefruit and orange. Initial flavor of orange with a nice bitterness in the middle, very well balancd flavor.
Aroma is orange, grapefruit and hops. Golden pour. Clear and bright. Taste is grapefruit a bit of orange and a long bitter finish. Very smooth and complex. Very good.

Pours dark goldish orange with a white head, aroma is a bit odd, smells a bit hoppy with orange and some pine, but there is a lot of buttery caramel notes as well, very different DIPA aroma than what Im used to. Taste is a bit different as well, sweet orange and caramel up front with a smooth creamy body, then it lingers in the back of your mouth with bitter pine, pretty balanced, but it leans to the sweeter side of a DIPA. pretty good .

Bottle courtesy of rudolf - thanks! Clear and bright light copper body with a large white head. Big a juicy aroma of tangerine, grapefruit, poached peach, pine, hint of orange blossom honey. Medium-full body, little sticky on the back of the palate. Flavour is big and boisterous and really nice - everything promised in the aroma comes through, along with some lime leaf, a bit of caramel sweetness, and nice lingering notes of grapefruit peel and pine needles. A standard bearer for the style.

22 ounce bottle dated 6/4/13 poured into a brandy snifter. Pours a vibrant copper with a thick froth of white foam. The aroma is big grapefruit, pine, and a touch of herbal grassy notes. The taste is on the more herbal bitter side with a caramel backbone coming through. Maybe this bottle isnt quite as fresh as it should be. Still, this is a pretty good beer.

22 ounce bottle into tulip glass, bottled on 6/4/2013. Pours fairly crystal clear golden amber color with a 2 finger dense and fluffy off white head with fantastic retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lasts. Spotty soapy lacing clings around the glass. Aromas of big grapefruit, tangerine, lemon zest, orange zest, pineapple, floral, pine, grass, bread, light caramel, and floral earthiness. Damn nice aromas with good balance and complexity of hop notes with a moderate malt balance; and good strength. Taste of big grapefruit, lemon zest, tangerine, pineapple, orange zest, floral, grass, pine, bread, light caramel, and floral earthiness. Fair amount of earthy pine bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of citrus, citrus zest, pineapple, floral, grass, pine, bread, light caramel, and floral earthiness on the finish for a while. Incredible balance and complexity of hop flavors; with a moderate malt balance behind the hops and zero cloying bitterness after the finish. Hop flavors are extremely smooth and non-astringent here. Medium carbonation and body; with a lightly creamy, crisp, and moderately sticky mouthfeel that is nice. Alcohol is very well hidden with only a light warming noticed after the finish. Overall this is an incredible DIPA style! Big complexity of citrus hop flavors with a moderate malt balance; and extremely smooth and crisp to sip on. A highly enjoyable offering.

Appearance was clear golden with lasting creamy huge 3 finger head, rings of lacing. Aromas are sweet 2-row, Vienna, crystal malts then the citrus and tropical hops come to play, no alcohol. Taste are sweet malt backbone upfront, then berry, tangerine, orange, melon and lemon. Alcohol comes in the backend. Palate was smooth creamy smooth CO2 with medium body, then, lasting smooth well balanced finish. A wonderful DIPA, try it u wont be disappointed.

A great brew. Bottle to tulip. Nose is huge grapefruit and tangerine with some resinous pine notes. Caramel and some sweetness. Flavor is similar. Very balanced sweetness amongst the big citrusy hop flavors. Very nice.

1 pt 6 fl oz bottle. Clear yellow amber colour, white fine foam head leaving alittle lacing and aroma of orange, grapefruit, resinous hop. Taste is malt caramel balanced against a citrusy hit of orange & grapefruit hoppy bitterness with resin, pine, vanilla, alcohol notes. Slightly oily mouthfeel, medium bodied, soft carbonation, warming dry lingering bitter finish. Very drinkable.

22oz bottle, split a few ways. Poured a golden orange color with a medium sized white head. Aroma was some notes of citrus and pine. Flavor was sweet malts. Flavor was a touch like an grapefruit and an orange moving through a pine forest. Nice citrus notes, bitter notes. Alcohol is there. This was pretty good.
Bomber from El Cerrito. Clear orange pour with a smaller foamy white head. Awesome citrus hop aroma - fresh and juicy. Rich citrus taste - tangerine. Big beer but very drinkable. Awesome.

Aroma of citrus hops, much lighter than I expected but very inviting. Pours a crystal clear orange with a thin white head. Flavour is of light crystal malts a slight sweetness kept in check, maybe too much, by powerful bitter hops. A slight astringentness on the early finish, changing to a perfectly balanced mildly sweet and bitter long finish. Warms the gullet.

On draft at the Blind Tiger Ale House, NYC. I had three of these as my session beer of choice. A truly crafted IPA in every sense. Well described commercially by the brewer. Elevated ABV is unapparent in flavor.

Bottle from Belmont Station. Hazy amber with a thin head. Amazing aroma of orange/tangerine, with some light raisin. Starts sweet, with orange and grapefruit, and leads into a bitter finish. Full body with high carbonation. Great!

UPDATED: AUG 16, 2013 Lots of pine, some citrus. Notes of peach, maybe pineapple? Tropical fruit of some sort. Very hop-forward. Very good. Been looking for this for about two years, I finally found it at some place in Philadelphia that sells bottles and seems to be a bar as well. And the Eagles were losing the preseason game too. As a lifelong Giants fan, I hate the Eagles. That just makes this beer even better.

Bomber from Portland shared by kevinsenn. Big tangerine aroma, like Christmas in the summer. Golden colour, more or less clear with good head. Sweeter than a typical IPA with a bitter finish. Cant tell if the light burn on the tongue is from alcohol or hops - probably a combination, but its not unpleasant. Well done.

Sweet and bitter aroma. Earthy organic. Thick orange cloudiness in color. Super packed with flavor. Very rich profile from start to finish. Buttery. Big farmhouse grain to it. Pine resin biter sticky. A bit rough and in your face. Man I want to try this on tap. To quote Ric Flair "Woooooo!". Its hard to explain the richness this beer has. This has that "I am going to kick your ass" personality to it! Love it!
Pours a light golden yellow with a small frothy white top. Aroma is citrus hops and light cereal grain. Taste is mostly citrus hop bomb with cereal malts.

22oz bomber. Pours a slightly hazy golden orange color with a huge foamy white head. Aroma of pineapple, mango, citrus, grapefruit, and honey. Taste of sweet honey malt, citrus, pineapple, grapefruit, and a pine.

Draft at the growler NYC on stone st. Pours a bronze sticky hoppy and boozy sweet taste. Not sure how its for summer but its a good heavy double iPa if you're in the mood for one. Classic west coast

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Recommend to any IPA lover as one of the best available Still would highly suggest to try this beer.

pours gold with a off white head that is silky in appearance. nose of light pine and citrus skins. taste has a solid malt base that holds the bitterness is balance. pine and booze burn on the finish. moderate carbonation keeps this light on the palate.

Brilliant golden copper with a medium sized head that leaves lots of thick lace. The aroma has a lot of grapefruit and orange peel, with some grassy/floral notes, and some mild but rich caramel. The flavor is much more resinous, with hints of citrus, very Columbus-like with caramel and residual sugars. Nice body on this, very full yet not overly sweet. Finishes dry, a tad on the bitter side, with a detectable yet reserved alcohol presence.

Pours a light Orange tight frothy head. Aroma is citrucy with some mango and tangerine notes. Taste followes the aroma well with some hop bitterness and a balanced malt. Not too complex. But very easy drinking great beer. Fruity beer. Citrucy. Not really blowing my socks off. Good brew though!

Bomber. Golden orange colored with a cap of white foam. Aroma is mostly citrus rind, pine resin and tropical fruit with a bit of sweet malt in the background. The taste blends grapefruit, orange and pine upfront followed by some resiny hops bitterness, pineapple and malt sweetness. Mouthfeel is medium-bodied with moderate carbonation and an aggressively bitter, grassy finish. Overall, a West Coast style hops bomb with plenty of balance between the ingredients. My kind of summer seasonal.

Bottle to pint glass
Spruce, bubble gum, hay, grapefruit. Clear amber with a thin white head. Cedar, hops and flowers.

22oz bottle from Belmont Station. 

A: Clear copper color with a firm, pillowy white head. Bubbles drift in straight lines through the body. Looks beautiful. 

N: Big pineapple and papaya nose. Mandarin orange and pine. Crystallized sugar. Some cheddar and floral elements.

T: Power hour of the bitterness. The hops are completely dominating, to the point where theres so little sweetness it becomes astringent. However, this starts to clear as the beer gets warmer. Pine and earth and a kind of burnt tobacco. 

M: Tons of alcohol and very dry. Stinging and resinous. 

O: An assaulting DIPA that does not let up. So aggressive it can be tiring, but at the same time, I continue to reach for it. Then the booze hits. I think I need a break.

Bottle thanks to a BIF from StephanSD. Aroma is wonderfully west coast. Pine resin, tropical fruit, and light citrus. Pours amber with a nice big head that is just sticky enough. Taste is a nice profile but not too bitter. Good resin, grass, citrus and a sweet malt. Great double but lacks a good punch. I guess thats why its the summer edition.

Bottle. Pours hazy golden with a medium sized frothy white head. Aroma is butterscotch, hops, grapefruit and citrus. Huge body with a lingering bitter aftertaste. Expected it to be a bit more balanced, too much butterscotch! Definitely a tasty one, but not amongst the best.

July 21, 2013 - bottle from Everetts. Clear golden pour with big time head and lacing. Aroma was fruity, malty and piney, very strong aroma that gets your attention. Taste had the sweet malty start with some fruit / citrus and then bam the piney bitterness smacks you in the face. Finish was a bit soapy and medium bodied.

Yeah, this is in the upper level of IPAs. Almost perfect balance of malt and hops, its a strong and flavorful IPA that doesnt completely wreck your palate. My only gripe, however, is that there really isnt anything notable about this to make it seasonal in any distinguishing way. I feel they could have at least specified that it was an IPA on the front of the bottle because I went in expecting something richer. Nevertheless, a great beer.
Bottle. Pours a clear gold with a little white, foamy head. Aroma is piney, resiny hops, flavor matches aroma.. Very little malt backbone, bitter finish.

Pours a golden yellow color with a thick white head. Aroma is heaven. Floral and citrus hops. The taste is just amazing. This is what every IPA should strive to taste like. I dont know what hops they used in this but I would guess Amarillo. The taste is smooth and hoppy. The malt backbone is perfect, not to sweet, not too light, just perfect. Grapefruit, orange rind, honey. So good.

A - pours clear golden light orange with low white tiny bubbled white head. S - resiny pine, light sweet passionfruit tropical fruity and ruby red grapefruit come next. Musty, earthy, with lightly soaps. M - medium body with a full smooth beautiful body. Fluffy carb. Lingering bitter dry end. T - resinous pine and tea bitters up front, tropical fruit and ruby red grapefruit move to a sturdy caramel malt backbone. The end is resinous and malty with some sweet simple sugars. O - very good dipa. 3.9

Bottle from the Bier Stein, Eugene. Pours a darker orange. Small amount of off-white. Aroma rich, floral, amazing. Body wonderful, lively balance with some creamy overtones. Finish crisp yet creamy. Doesnt get much better than this...

Clear golden yellow with thick fluffy white head. Aroma is piney flowery hops. Taste is dank resinous pine with grapefruit citrus follow through with a soft malty backbone. Aftertaste is lingering bitter resinous piney hops. Palate is sticky resin. Overall great balance and delicious hoppy bite. Outstanding double IPA.

Wow!!! Such a great ipa. I had to buy a bottle in Ohio. So thankful and lucky to drink this one. Any hophead out there will love this beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A long time want for me. The pour is yellowy orange with a white foam like head that leaves quite the lacing. The aroma is heavenly. Huge piney hop aroma. I would love a side by side with Enjoy By and PtE. I think the alcohol is a bit more noticeable in the taste than both of those. This is still smooth and delicious. Such a good beer before Independence Day. Also #50 IIPA!

On cask @ the brewery. Pours cloudy medium golden with small head. Aroma is big bitter citrus notes. Taste is clean, sweet somewhat thin body. Massive hops - notes of pine, grass, grapefruit. Bitterness lingers but not so much that it interferes with the crisp finish. Incredibly drinkable for the abv.

Bottle. Gold pour. Big white head that recedes to a quarter of an inch and lasts a long time. Aroma is pine, citrus and light alcohol. Flavor is pine resin, with some citrus and slightly sweet malts. Palate is slightly sticky. Body is medium. Level of carbonation is medium to low.

Bottle pours clear dark yellow with one finger head that fades to a persistent film. Pine/citrus aroma. Very clean taste of citrus with just the right amount of sweet malts. Full palate, not sticky or syrupy. Nice hop and alcohol tingle. Finish of pine hops but not overbearing. Im not a big IPA guy but this is very good.
Id heard good things about this one and it did not disappoint. Bottle from Nugget. Lots of complex hop flavors, unique citrus profile, pine, spices... very good.

Pours golden orange, with a medium off white head. Aroma is stone fruit and berries with some pine and tropical fruit too. The aroma dominates this big ipa, and much more complex than the flavor, which is a bit underwhelming compared to the aroma, but the aroma is so good thard not a knock. Really good beer.

UPDATED: APR 17, 2014 Bottle. Somewhat hazy dark golden with a white dens head. Aroma has tropical fruits in perfect balance with the malt notes. Citrus, pine, pineapple, mango... Taste is pine bitterness with a fruity sweetness and light malty sweetness followed by a nice dry lingering bitter finish. Truly great!

[US West Coast Trip 2013] Tap @ Alesmith Brewing Co. San Diego. ÄLSKA ! Bästa IIPAn ever. Den behöver inte vara överhumlad den behöver inte vara 15% ! Det här är så jävla bra! Säger dock inte den var klen på något sätt för det var den verkligen inte! Humlig, kryddig, fruktig, lite jordig och så grapefrukten på det. Och sen lyckas balansera allt till perfektion med beskan. KÄRLEK !
Huge bitter citrius hop bomb. Taste is a bitter hop bomb. Very much of a palate wrecker. Good stuff, but not as good as the standard ipa.

Pours a cloudy gold. White head that doesn't last. Citrusy, piney aroma and taste. Very good.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Aroma is pine, spices, citrus and a small hint of nuttiness. The flavor is grapefruit, citrus, fruit, malts and a tart/bitter finish.

22 ounce bottle. Thanks Mike! Pours a cloudy golden orange with a nice fluffy white head. Aroma of citrus, florals, pine, and caramel. Taste is grapefruit, oranges, pine, florals, and caramel. Delicious!

Bottle. Gold pour, big white head. Some retention/lace. Aroma is big citrus, pine, vanilla, earth, caramel. Taste is moderately bitter, pine/citrus, some malt sweetness. Palate is soft, creamy, quenching, bitter finish. Good.

Pours slightly hazy gold with white head. Aroma is very rich floral and citrus, smells awesome. Rich caramel malt body, lots of spiciness. Lots of floral and citrus hops, grapefruit and orange and all sorts of fruitiness. Pretty great IIPA.

Wonderful. Unexpectedly wonderful. I never know what to expected by these special series brews. But alesmith is always solid so i took a shot. Wonderfully balanced. Floral, and sweet citrus aroma. Smooth sweet start. Nice malt backbone. Then BAM! Bitter piney bite rounds it out. Really good. I am a hop snob and ipas are my beer of choice, especially summer months. This stands up to some of the very best. Nicely done Alesmith. Nicely done...

From bottle to tulip and enjoyed exactly at the summer solstice. Massive amounts of citrus flow out of the glass with spice and stone in strong support. Pours a clear honey-orange with a white head that leaves a small blanket across the top of the beer. Taste is mainly citrus with a strong malt backbone with cracker in support. Bitterness is very high, but the alcohol and malt balance it nicely so that it is not cloying. Finishes dry with astringent puckering in a nice manner. Welcome to Summer!!

Clear medium gold.Some tiny floaties.,good head.lace.
Spicey peppery strong hoppy nose pungent with fruit.Pine,citrus.Some sweetness,slight breadiness.
Taste is smooth,strong,hoppy piney,medium-light body,dry finish but wet piney,juicey,peppery finish.Very nice.
From a 22 oz bottle shared with family. Pours a clear orange with an off white head. Citrus hop nose. Some grass notes. Bitter finish. Nice DIPA.

Once again, I am so happy I can buy AleSmith beers right here in North central Illinios. Golden yellow pour with a white head. Aroma is fruity hops. Taste is very hoppy and very tasty. Nice spicy hop aftertaste. Nice lacing. A very enjoyable drinking experience.

Amazing ale. Pours a clean orange. Clean crisp citrus hop aroma. Nice malt hops balance in taste. Not overwhelming on either end. Very good and can see why the over all rating is very high. Will buy again.

Pours amber with a white head. Good retention. Grapefruit, citrus, pine, some sweetness and a lingering bitterness at the finish. Very nice. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

No, I think this is easily a fantastic IPA in virtually every sense. It pours clear medium gold with an average white head in this glass. Retention is above average, with some spotting present here. The hop presence on the nose is robust; its spicy, piney, bread, grapefruit rind, and tangerine comes through. The flavor profile is initial bittering hops; resinous piney, and light spicing. It moves to cream, caramel, sweet bread, with a lingering and vibrant hop note near the finish. Yes, a terrific, albeit slightly dating presentation of a california ipa.

UPDATED: JUN 11, 2017 This got better as it warmed, although not *much* better. The front was floral, candy, and lightly like fresh plastic. The flavor was reasonably robust but still not extraordinary. A good IPA but the shine long ago left Alesmith as a top notch (like, top 5) brewer in the USA, much less the world. Bottle. Original rating 6/16/2013, 7/3/7/3/13--3.3 // Re-rated 6/11/2017. Not a heavy body, dry flavor and strikingly bitter finish. A little better than first rated, but not massively so; its just too sharp (even before the finish) to match my flavor interests. Bottle.
Amazing IPA super hoppy smooth intense, on tap in Claremont california, one of the top San Diego beers

Bomber, bottled 5/21/2013 and consumed 6/12/2013.  Aroma: bread, caramel, citrus, pine.  Snappy, almost spicy orange hidden in there.  Pours clear light amber with 2 fingers of white, dense, creamy head that sticks around.  Taste is moderately sweet start, full bitter flourish in the middle, giving way to alcohol and a lingering caramel bitter-sweet symphony.   Medium-full body, average carbonation, smooth, almost creamy texture. Were it not for the moments of harsh alcohol notes in the taste, this would be pretty magical.

Poured from the bottle into the wrong glass, turns out this glass had been sitting around. Anyways. Aroma is very citrusy and some dank qualities. Fantastic. Flavor is bitter but well balanced. Palate is medium body with a oily finish. Amazing. Ale Smith never disappoints. Very clear and thick head. Paired nicely with a buritto and chips and salsa.
UPDATED: JUN 15, 2013 On tap at city beer. Pours copper with white head. Taste is earthy hops with a slight citrus.
Yes, a perfect 5. I can find no faults with this beer...great appearance, aroma and body and a perfect balance. Nice bitter finish, not too sweet and the alcohol is well hidden.

22oz bottle pours a golden color with thick foamy head. For the level of alcohol and hops in this beer, it is just so easy going. No harsh flavors from the hops. Just so well balanced. My favorite double IPA.

Had this one a few times and found it to be good but not excellent. Defintly has one of the hop varieties that they are playing up. Fairly piny and somewhat bitter. Nice bite and good flavor. Reinforced my prior opinion...good not great.

22/10/2011 Domus Birrae (650ml bottle). Stappata alla Tana. Dorata carica, molto limpida, bella schiuma biancastra morbida, molto persistente. Aroma di malto, zuccheroso, solo vaghi accenni di luppolo, erbaceo e agrumato. In bocca conferma le sensazioni olfattive, ha un forte attacco di caramello, eccessivo, quindi il luppolo prende leggermente il sopravvento, senza però incidere più di tanto. Corpo medio-pieno, carbonazione corretta. Per niente fresca, peccato.

Bottle. Clear gold pour with thin white head. Hoppy aroma, lots of honeyed malts, a bit malt forward, showing signs of age. Taste of bittering hops, most hops have faded, lots of honey, light oxidization. Still, pretty decent for an old IPA.

Bottle 22oz.
Pours blond with low white head. Aroma is of malt, fruits, very sligth pine. Taste is of malt, citrus, fruits. Overall: Bottle was a bit old, so the malt presence is overfelt.

Bottle from Tommy, thanks! Pours a hazy light copper with white head and nice lacing. Aroma is resinous, citrus, a bit oxidized, hoppy. Taste is resinous, citrus, no too bitter, light caramel, a bit soapy. Medium body and merdium carbonation. This one might be a bit old so i would like to revisit this one fresh. Still enjoyable.

Bottle (22 oz). Pours golden with a small white head and good lacing. Aroma is of citrus (orange & grapefruits) with malt, earthy notes and slight resinous presence. Taste is slightly to moderately sweet with soapy notes, malt, citrus, earthy notes, resinous presence and moderate bitterness. Medium body. Maybe a tad old, but I can see that its a good beer!

Blonde presque limpide, une mousse typique la recouvre, en faisant un travail de dentelle. Au nez, des arômes de houblon, de parfume printanier, de zeste de citron et le pamplemousse, forment ses particularités olfactives. Le goût est sur le même terrain, alors que les houblons semble savonneux, ils prennent possession du palais et lalcool est très discret. Lamertume nest jamais plus intense que longue en arrière-goût. Merci Louis! (553-120113)

Bottle courtesy of Kermis. Poured a cloudy medium amber with a huge frothy white head and lots of broken lace. The aroma is yeasty and zesty. The flavour is medium to strong bitter, hoppy, alcoholic liqourice and some orange on the palate. A superb beer.

66cl bottle courtesy and shared with Kermis
Thin creamy white head.  Hazy golden blond pour.  Lovely bitterness.  An awesome brew!

Bottle shared.  Pours hazy golden with a small off white head.  Aroma of caramel malt, orange, grapefruit, pine.  Flavour is over moderate sweet and bitter.  Medium to full bodied with soft carbonation.

Dark cloudy orange body with a big white head. Truly extraordinary complex bittersweet floral aroma full of fruits like orange, mango, pineapple, grapefruit, mandarin, peach, as well as pine, caramel, various spices. Full, perfectly carbonated body. Great flavour with orange and grapefruit, caramel and pine, mandarin and peach. Amazing.

Had this in the middle of winter in Riga, Latvia (Alehouse) Feb 2013, made some notes, pours cloudy golden, orange with a large head leaving a decent lacing. Big aroma with piney hops and citrus, lemon, orange & grapefruit. Thick palate. lively carbonation. Very moreish, sweet & bitter but well balanced and crisp finish. Excellent.

UPDATED: FEB 9, 2014 Purchased from Learys earlier today for $7.55 exactly. To oversized snifter, it pours a hazy tangerine orange with a trim, thin white ring. Aromas of malt, hop pellets, and not much else. Perhaps some black olives and grapes? Tastes as described:  tangerine, earth, caramel and pine. Needs more hops, though. Maltier than expected. Chewy. Id like if more had the body been lighter, too. But Im not really complaining. Still a solid DIPA.

Aroma: Great freshness, citrus and summer flowers, wonderful smell!
Appearance: Pale and hazy with a minimal head.
Taste: Exciting and complex. Refreshing and well balanced, though unfortunately, the more you drink the more the sweetness and alcohol dominates, which is a drawback.
Palate: medium body, oily feel, soft carbonation, bitter.
I think it is a very good beer but I wouldnt define it as a being a summer beer. On a hot summer day this beer would be quite a challenge to drink simply on its own.
Summer beer at it?s best. Pines, parks, beaches and lightly dressed women.. A bit too alcoholic on a second thought though. Come on summer!

65cl bottle. Some sweet, subtle sour and spicy aromas. Pours very hazy, golden, with nice creamy whie head, persistent, some lacing. Medium body, oily texure, average carbonation.Taste is mild bitter, some sweet, spicy, with a sweet afertaste. Nice and enjoyable.

Drank from bomber poured into tulip glass. Aroma- nice citrus notes but nothing overwhelming. Appearance- beautiful golden orange with very nice glow. Taste - not as hoppy as i would expect from a DIPA but is great for the summer season. Very smooth with a bit of butter. Palate- piny and citrus palate. Very nice. Overall- this is a good everyday beer but nothing that makes it stand out

660ml bottle (ALEhouse, Riga, MelnaZiema2013)
Perfumey malty aroma, a little floral. Quite sweet. Soft body, nice carbonation. Pleasnt hoppy bite. Dry woody finish. Crisp, and focussed. Pretty OK for AleSmith.

Bottle from The Bottleshop, Canterbury. The pours deep orange with a lively white head. The nose is strong syrupy sweetness. Caramel candy corn, loads of orange liqueur, fruit by the foot candy, mild grass. The taste is heavy sryrup sweetness. Mild touches of stale pine wood hoppiness. Some mango and citrus. But overall this tastes like a faded sugarbomb. The bodys full, slightly hot. Overall, its a real shame to try a prestigious IPA in this state. Clearly its faded badly. Its a reminder that I probably shouldnt bother to buy bottled American DIPAs in the UK.

Bomber split with my good beer buddy Wild Thing.

Beautiful deep orange with a firm thick top of rocky white foam. Heady aroma of citrus. Nice dominanct bitter burr. Superb backbone which is angular I firm but well balanced with marmaled fruit and extra orange peel. Bitterness is superbly integrated making a suoer integrated whole.

Bottle. Clear golden color. Tiny off-white head, stays. Juicy, perfume, hops, tropical fruits in aroma. Superb aroma. First thing I notice in flavor is dead yeast. But in some way it is not that disturbing. Hops and juicy fruits and mild bitterness disguise it somewhat. Decent brew.

65 cl bottle @ home. Pours cloudy golden with a little sediment and a white head that leaves some lacing. Aroma is grapefruit, citrus, pine, and caramel. Flavour is pine, caramel, and citrus  with a very bitter finish.

0,65 l bomber, shared with friends.
Poured hazy yellow with a creamy white head. Really spicy aroma with orange peel resin and floral hops, vanilla, grapefruit. Wow! Fine balanced  body with a powerful hopbomb with resin, citrusses, grapefruit, light and mild sweetness with resin, pine and some resin with some pine and resin. Goooooood, yumm!

Thx. to tderoeck (Tim) for sharing this one // 66 cl. @ Tims De Molen & assorted beers tasting // a summer holiday IIPA, ok // bright golden with a small white head // smell is of fruity American citrus hops, soft, slight sweetness, touch lemon, white bread, tropical & summer fruits // taste is bitter floral, yeast, some softer sweeter summer & hint tropical fruits, touch bitter summer fruits, some tad too bitter herbs fro me, flowers // m/m // not bad at all

Slightly hazy golden colour, white head. Aroma of American hops, tropical fruits, citrus, honey and apricot. Light earth touch. Hop bitter flavour, light sweetness. Sweet and bitter finish with lasting fruitiness.
(From 66cL bottle at the DMT @ Tims living, Gent. Shared by tderoeck. Thanks, Tim!)

UPDATED: JAN 9, 2013 30/XII/12 - 1Pt. 6Fl. Oz. bottle from Geers (Oostakker) @ home: De Molen & assorted beers tasting - BB: n/a (2012-1418) 
Clear blond to light orange beer, creamy irregular head, unstable, bit adhesive. Aroma: very fruity, passion fruit, sweet mango, lychee, bit piny. MF: soft carbon, full body. taste: bit sweet, malty, some honey, very fruity, sweet mango, piny bitter hops, more malts. Aftertaste: still fruity, citrus, piny, grapefruit, bitter hops. Really good stuff!

22 ounce bottle. Cloudy pale gold color. Large bubbly white head. Sweet grapefruity hop aroma. Flavor is all bitter grapefruit hops and sweet toasted malt. Piney and peppery. No complexity or unique character. If you love hops, you will love this. I personally think this is a one-trick pony. lacks the malt balance I would prefer.

Nice one. Except that compared 100/100 with my opinion - Im confused. Its is heavily hop loaded, but again seems that monolithic. Flavor of grapefruit bitterness. Sweet start in taste with bitter, pine way, spicy-dry finish. Alco shoulder through aroma. Pale color from not any darker malt - cloudy golden, bubbly with good stamina white-off top. Good appearance, above medium body, nice mouthfeel. Really nice one but... it is not interesting, not amazing - so those 100/100 is ... not to me.

This is a great IPA. Has deeply rich flavor, and appropriately bitter. Almost a standard bearer for the category!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: OCT 2, 2016 2015-11-25 as Summer YuleSmith: Bottle. Hazy yellow straw with a white head. Aroma has notes of resin, pine, caramel, toffee, lemon/citrus fruits. Taste is sweet and light oily with notes of  caramel, leading to pine, grapefruit and peach with a crisp slightly astringent hoppy finish. Very well balanced and drinkable. If you dont like this one; go see a doctor. 8+3+8+4+18=4.1


Bottle as Alesmith Double IPA. Nose is slightly cheesy with some citrus, hay and dough. Flavour has flowers, citrus, pine, sharpness and alcohol. Ok balance, but a bit alcoholic.

En sødlig Ipa. Dufter af mandarin og abrikos. Meget lys med let skum som er nem at fremkalde. Er selvfølgelig humlet men også meget sødlig i smagen og smager af lyse frugter. Rar bitter sød eftersmag.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
To much alcohol sweetness and not very special. An allround ipa, but expected more. Maybe less alcohol could male it better.
UPDATED: APR 5, 2013 grassy, tangerine aroma. light yellow w white foam, spicy hops and sweet alc in taste, rich mouthfeel, a bit too much alc vol after a while.
Notes of grass aroma. A bit too much alco-taste. The alcohol pushes the hops a bit in background.
This is a very good IPA. The best thing is the aroma. The taste is good too, but it may be a bit too trivial

Bomber to tulip.  Pours a cloudy pale orange color with small white head that lingers a while and collects at the edges.  Big lacing and webbing on the glass.  Very fruity aroma.  Smells a kinda like the syrup from a canned fruit cocktail.  Lots of oranges, pineapple, grapefruit, cherries, and pears.  Taste is sweet fruit syrup at first and then turns moderately bitter very quickly.  Finish still has the fruit from the aroma but also getting pine and spiciness.  Medium body and somewhat sticky and oily mouthfeel.  I love the complexity of this but its a tad sweet.  Overall its still really good though.

(Bottle, Stockholm Beer Festival, 6 Oct 2012) Hazy golden colour with frothy, off-white head. Fruity, hoppy nose with notes of tropical fruit, citrus and resinous hops. Malty, fruity taste with apricots, tropical fruit, lychee and a generous grapefruity bitterness in a finish with a slight alcohol bite. Almost full body, with a certain sweetness. Quite fresh for a double IPA. Very nice.

Once again, an absolute stunner from Alesmith. Pours a golden/orange colour, much lighter than expected, medium white head. Big aromas of grapefruit, orange and other citrus fruits, a long with some sweet malt smells. The taste is stunning, again, like their IPA, supremely balanced, loads of hops with the fruits and bitterness, perfectly complimented by a strong malt backbone. A long, bitter finish and a good full body. An excellent beer which I would have on a regular basis if it were easier to get hold of.

Pithy sweet citrus and mango, gentle carbonation, ever so moreish, bottle finished in short shrift. Would drink again in an instant.

UPDATED: JAN 23, 2016 Darker golden coloured. Good head. Good grassy and citrus hoppy smell and taste. Expected just more from this one, slightly needs a boost. Good biterness. Added 0.1 after retaste.

Thanks to mrmiles for the bomber! (reviewed from notes 9/25)

A: Pours a very hazy gold/straw color with a big fluffy head. Retention is perfect! Gorgeous pour, and the head is similar to Alesmiths IPA, which basically looks like meringue

S: The nose is kind of subtle, but very balanced. Lots of pale malts play well with a huge citrus note (tangerine, grapefruit, pineapple, and mango). This is awesome - Sculpins cousin

T: Huge bitterness upfront that is balanced by a nice honey-like sweetness. Yeast is unique, and quite flavorful. Citrus, tropical fruit hops are here also.

MF/D: Slightly prickly carbonation, but otherwise medium body and pretty smooth. Bittersweet citrus finish.

Notes: AleSmith makes some damn good offerings. I believe this is my third offering after Speedway and their IPA, all of which received near-perfect scores.

Bottle @ Haandverkerstuene,Oslo.October 23,2012.
Amber to copper in color.Aroma is yeast, citrus, hops, some caramel and pine. Medium carbonation.Hoppy and bitter taste.A bit dry bitter finish.

Bottle drank in late Oct.  Deep clear gold with little head but lots of legs.  Aroma is big and rich american hops with pine, very ripe tropical fruit, funk, and some yeasty cheese notes.  The flavor is moderately strong caramel, resin, musky grapes, yeast, old cheese. Sweetness is overpowered by the bitterness though it ends fairly dry. Mouthfeel is sticky and lightly astringent. Not my favorite Alesmith but still very good.   Will definitely seek it out for closer to its release to ensure its freshest.
Bottle from Brewdog shop. Amber color, white head. Intense bitter taste with much citrus, floral hops, some caramel, resin and pine. Dry bitter finish. Excellent DIPA.
Sample @ SBWF 12. Golden colour with an off-white head. Sweet fruit, citrus aroma. Dry fruit, caramel flavour.

Sampled at SBWF11
Hazy golden. White head.
Sweet and creamy aroma and flavour.
Medium bitterness.

2012 bottle. Pours a nice hazy gold with plenty of white head. Aroma is a nice balance between grapefruit citrus and some darker, almost Skunky aromas. Taste is really dead on for a west coast dipa. Sweet, very aggressive in citrus flavors but not bitter. Finishes rather quenching.

12 oct 2012, bottle. Ruby/brown, clear. Nose is sweet raisins, bread crust, white grapes. Med body and mildly fizzy. Tastes of faint warm cherries, red ale, and decent resin hops. Very nice. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Stockholm Beer & Whiskey 2012: Humlig och besk med en tyvärr lite spritig ton. Helt ok.

65cl bottle (2011) at Schouskjelleren with Arve_Christian. Pours clear golden with a white head. Hoppy and fruity aroma with malt, caramel and hints of yeast, citrus and alcohol. Sweet and malty with a fruity and a bit hoppy and bitter finish. Very nice, but would love to try this fresh on a later occasion. (2012-10-04)

Sample at SBWF 2012.

A bit hazy orange with a small head. Hoppy and fruity aroma and taste. Nice bitterness with some malt. A solid and well-made beer.

65 cl bottle 2011 edition, bottle at Schouskjelleren .
Golden color, good foam.
Immediate caramel aromas, some fruitiness
Full body & high complexity .
Sweet , also good bitterness-good carbonation & balance .
Very enjoyable power beer

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Pours a nice hazy orange color with a white head. Aroma is of bitter grapefruit, orange, sweet and caramel malts, pine and apricot. The flavor is nice and hoppy with the pine, apricot, bitter grapefruit and sweet orange flavors, I also get some sweet and caramel malt notes and an almost syrupy flavor, The body is medium with a sticky and dry mouth feel. Overall a pretty nice DIPA!
Bottle. Pours pours hazy orange with a big white head. The aroma is full of pine with a little citrus. The taste is bitter with a big grapefruit kick.
Piney, hoppy aroma full bodied. Mostly opaque golden yellow. Tastes Hoppy, classic hoppy imperial ipa. Very smooth, light palate, overall a kick ass beer.

Bottle ordered from internet. Bottled in 2011. Pours dark and deep cloudy amber with a great thick head. Fabulous aromas of grapefruit, apricot, peach, pine, some balenced caramel. Flavors of pine, citrus, apricots, tinge of alcohol(very slight), and caramel backbone. Highly bitter mostly in the finish, medium sweet from the malts and a medium dry finish. The malts seem to come through more in the nose which would reveal a overpowering of the hops. Wasnt thinking this was a DIPA. I really dig the dark cloudness from the yeasts. Pleasant surprise I guess.
Bottle @ BrewDog Glasgow. Yellow amber colour, good head. Spicy hop aroma. Flowery fruity hop flavour. Bitter aftertaste.

Bottle 2 Beer tasting club - Poured a straw colour which is unexpected for a DIPA expected more of an Orange you get with a West Coast DIPA. Load of refreshing hops in aroma, resiny mouth feel with the citrus, grapefruit and pine you expect. One of the best Ive had.

I have had this one before and it is wonderfull. However this bottle was totally off. I assume the capsule on this bottle has not been airtight, so it was totally without carbonization. It went down the drain.

UPDATED: NOV 27, 2012 Bottle pour, cloudy golden color, very little head but that may be due to a bad pour. Grapefruit aroma with some other sweeter citrus i can?t identify. Elegant flavor profile: understated citrus bitterness, a resin note, caramel sweetness, and some tobacco spice combine perfectly. Certainly one of the more complex IPAs I have had. Stunning.

Bottle @ Sorbon. Pours slightly cloudy light amber with medium off-white head. Aroma of tropical fruit, resin, pine, grapefruit. Taste is initially bitter, with a subtle fruit sweetness before opening up into a pungent, long bitterness, still with lots of fruit notes. Very balanced. Medium to full body, slightly oily and with some prickly carbonation. Looong finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

New Beer Distributors, NY 650ml ($6.25): Pours a mostly golden colour with a small white head. Aroma is citrus, pine, spice, dirt, and a healthier dosing of malts than I had anticipated. Taste is rather hoppy, but it is hardly extreme. Malt backbone is solid, but it doesnt impede the easy-drinking. Aftertaste, too, is significantly more mild, but in some ways the aftertaste is the best part of this beer. Pretty dope. Note: 2011 bottle, so that would explain the hops getting attenuated.

Picked up a bomber bottle at Bi-Rite Market in San Diego, CA.  Poured it into a tulip glass.  Pours a hazy golden color with a fluffy white head.  Nice bands of lacing.  Great, spicy aromas of citrus, pineapple, and sweet banana; a little bit of alcohol scent peeking through.  Flavors are excellent and so well balanced...very fruity and spicy, but with a hefty dose of sweet malt.  Fine carbonation and a tingly, lightly bitter finish that warms your mouth up.  Chewy, substantial feel, but not off-puttingly heavy.  Damn, this stuff is really excellent.  Alesmith does it again...

On tap at TJs Everyday, Paoli, PA - 25/05/12.
Golden copper colour with a white head.
Citrus hops, tropical fruit and a little malt on the nose.
More fruit and hop in the taste than malt.
Medium bodied, average carbonation.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: A solid beverage. The spices, hops, & malts all bring their own distinctive flavors. What makes this beverage a must is the quality of those ingredients. I enjoyed the pine notes the best. I will look for this again next season.

bomber purchased in CA and poured into glass;  slight aroma of citrus (orange and tangerine?)   and slight toffee.  Taste was hops but smooth hops followed by some bitter.  pretty well balanced but the aftertaste was a little strong.  I am not a fan of ipas but this was good and strong...

The name makes sense, by the time you brew up the Christmas IPA in India and sail it back to good ol England, its summer (or it would be is a part of the world that had a real summer).  The theme makes sense also, as the piney aroma brings back the tang of splintered masts, while the flavor has a surprising darkness that brings back the memories of resin and pitch.   There is a nice blend of citrus to protect against scurvy, and trying to walk on dry land after a voyage of that length would be similar to trying to walk on dry land after a few of these.    Bully!
Pours a pale golden. Lacey head. Nose is pine and gardenia or plumeria. Really good.

Aroma is mostly citrussy hops. Very pale golden color with a decent foam. Flavor is decently balanced hops and malt. Subtle bitterness and carbonation. Overall, I was a little dissapointed with this IPA. Alesmith usually makes great beer but i thought this was a little watered down and not very complex. Id give this a B- rating.

Bottle from Hegedorns. Very fragrant, floral nose, lots of fruit: grapefruit, apricot, orange, soap, honey. Deep gold with orange tints, oily, with a fine, low head. Very fruity, tangy grapefruit and orange, lightly tropical, a bit of alcohol, peppery hops, some pine, crackery malt. Oily, full body. Unique and lovely. Bitter hops and alcohol finish.

2011 Vintage. Pours light orange with a creamy white head and really nice soapy lacing on the glass. Aroma is pineapple and hops. Taste is sour malt and pineapple with a bit of a piney hop bitterness. The hops have mellowed over the past several months Im sure, but its still quite good.

Cloudy golden with fluffy white head.  Aroma is primarily citrus and hops.  Starts off with a dry floral hoppiness smooths out into some tart citrus flavors (grapefruit is what I pick out most), then back to a dry floral finish. A superb, balanced, complex IPA.

Tap. This is an awesome IPA. Pours hazy golden amber with a small white head and some lacing. Aroma is very Pliny-like, dominated by grapefruit with traces of pine. Flavor is also grapefruit dominated, with traces of mild sweet caramel malt. Finish is medium bitter and warming from the ABV.

Bottle.  Thanks Kevin!  Pours unclear dark golden with a large white head.  Great citrusy hop aroma with a hint of caramel sweetness.  Flavor of citrus and pine hops with a light caramel/toffee like backbone.  Nice long-lasting bitter hop finish.  Great beer.
750 mL bottle.  Wow.  Sweet and bitter citrus, grapefruit, a touch of resin, caramel, brown sugar, lingering bitter finish, balance, complexity, perfect body, etc, etc, stc.

UPDATED: AUG 21, 2015 22 oz. bomber.  Poured hazy orange with flat appearance.  Only a subtle hint of carbonation present.  Flavor of sweet malt, caramel, and pine.  A touch boozy.  Damn disappointing that the carbonation was off, especially with the price tag this one comes with.  

Re rate. 22 oz. bomber. Poured hazy orange with thick fluffy head.  Balanced pine and citrus.  Malty with subtle notes of chocolate and granola. Silky mouthfeel.

This beer has a medium light mouthfeel with light carbonation. There is a smooth feeling to it. Overall it is a really nice beer, very well done and very drinkable, although I can feel the alcohol. I definitely would recommend this to hoppy loving drinkers.

Another damn good DIPA.  Pale golden orange alittle out of focus,(not me).  Lemon like citrus nose.  Up front bitter with citrus mixed with a good ambrosial of malts.  Good body.  Dry finish with alittle burn.  Great bold flavors.  ya got to luv it!

Bottle at home, brought back from City Beer in San Francisco; from my Minneapolis Town Hall glass. Rated while entering backlog from my NorCal trip. Pours clear golden with an orange hue. Thick white head, really nice lacing. Nose is really something: grapefruit, fleshy peach and nectarines, biting citrus, this actually reminds me quite a bit of Pliny... Florals and soap round out the nose. Flavours are sweeter than I expected, but by no means overly sweet, just a caramelly twist right in the mid-palate. Really nice flavours of grapefruit, mandarin and navel oranges, a bit of biting pine, definite honey notes. Very tingly along the sides of my tongue, which I like. Fantastic IIPA!

Bottled acquired in a trade with hophead247. Thanks! Shared with drabmuh at my house recently. Review from notes.

This DIPA is clear and has a golden color with a good-sized head and nice lacing throughout the glass.

The aromas are a nice bouquet of hops, followed by a sturdy malt presence. I would prefer more hop aromas and flavors and less malt in this beer. There is a slight burn in the finish, though I dont find it to be overly harsh. Overall, this was a nice tasting brew and Im glad I had the opportunity to try it.

Bottle at home with my dad. Poured  a golden, orange color with a frothy white head and good lacing. Smell is earthy, spicy hops, pine, grass, and caramel. Taste is spicy orange, dirt, earth, caramel, toffee, floral hops, and dark fruits. Somewhat creamy mouthfeel with medium carbonation. Overall, a very earthy and spicy tasting IPA, lightly malty, toffee and caramel, but somehow well-balanced and pretty tasty.

Golden orangeish color, frothy white head with some nice lacing. Aroma is full of resinous pine, and citrusy hops. Clean dry bitterness, lots of grapefruit pith, some lingering herbal and pine flavors. Light malts in the background a hint of alcohol apparent in the finish. Very well done.

resin, floral, clear, golden, white foam, frothy, very bitter, medium sourness, light sweetness, medium body, creamy, soft carbonation, bitter, long finish

First beer officially rated, though I have had many the past 2.5 years - this is a great beer from a great brewery - a great bodied and well balanced DIPA with one of the best aromas Ive come across.  Grab it while you can.

Draught at Monkey Paw. Almost cler, golden liquid with medium off-white head. Aroma of pine, sweet tropical fruit, pineapple, citrus, grapefruit, caramel, mango and lemongrass. Taste is dry and medium to high bitter with notes of mango, passionfruit and caramel. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Really nice IIPA.

Bottle from Whole Foods in Glendale. It's like Xmas in July: balanced, hoppy, but more smooth than intensely bitter. Pairs well with food. A great summer beer despite its name. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle: Yule love it, awesome, perfect, grand, perfection, flawless, any questions? Food Pairing: Nothing youll ruin it.

Draft at alesmith tasting room with Linh. Pours a hazy amber body with thin white lacig. Aroma is super fresh grapefruit and pine hops. Mouthfeel is softer than expected with notes of fruity, citrus hops, light pine, lots of mango and grapefruit. Nice.

UPDATED: JUN 26, 2016 Re-rate:  from a 12oz into a snifter.  REally liked this a lot more this time.  lots more tropical flavors and aromas and a nice light body.  still San Diego bitter, but very, very  good.  plus the 12 oz serving and associated price dont hurt either.

From a bomber poured into a snifter. Pours an unexpectedly light straw color. Moderate non sticky head and very light lacing. Aroma of hop-skunk, booze stinky cheese and tropical fruit. Very powerful aroma. Mouthfeel is very light. Taste is mainly of booze, banana, flowers, chalk and pineapple. Overall a good but not great IIPA. Little too hot. For the price Id probably not buy it again. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bomber to pint glass. Clear, light golden pour. Wonderful nose of orange, peach, nectarine. Very fruity! Flavors more of the same, w/ a bit of alcohol burn. Some floral & pine in there, as well. Finishes pretty clean & dry. Good!
22 oz. Bottle, pours a clear gold with a white head, and good lacing. Aromas of citrus and malts. Taste is hoppy with some sweet malts, and a dry finish. This is a lovely beer.

Murky orange-gold with good, foamy, white head / Bright nose of citrus, pine, weed, and cream / Medium body, creamy, some sweetness with profound but not overly biting hops, excellent balance and bitter finish  / Elegant and bright flavors of orange, cream, grapefruit, cut pine, soap, and spun sugar / Perfect.

Great example of a DIPA.  Dry, very bitter, and refreshing without being heavy at all.  Nose has a lot of citrus, some pine and a little spice.  It hits your palate and knocks it out with pine and bitter resin.  I love beers like this.  One of the best Imperial IPAs Ive had.

Location/Date:Bottle on June 30th, 2012..
Appearance: Pours a clear copper.
Aroma: Aroma is of citrus and hop.
Taste: Nice amount of bitterness, citrus of tangerine, pine, some spice.
Palate: Medium body.
Summary: I love loVE LOVE Yulesmith Winter so had to try this when I saw it at Whole Foods Bowery (NYC).  This did not disappoint.

Bottle, poured a golden color, with medium white head, and nice lacing. Aromas of pine, grapefruit citrus, malts. Taste is very tropical and hoppy with some sweet malt, pineapple and pine in the bitter, dry finish. Medium bodied for a double ipa. Nicely balanced. Would love to try this on tap instead of bottle

UPDATED: MAY 9, 2014 Pours a bright golden orange with a foamy, bubbly white head with very nice lacing.  Aroma is of aromatic citrus, pine resin, floral hops, and some tropical fruits.  Taste is of citrus (grapefruit dominated with some tangerine and orange), pine resin, floral hops, tropical fruits (pineapple and some mango) some earthiness,, some sweet malts, and a little caramel malt.  Has a medium-full body with  a super creamy mouthfeel, and a dry,bitter, but sweet, well balanced finish.  overall, a amazing DIPA that hides its alchool very well.  definitely belongs among the best DIPAs in the world.
Hazy gold with a thick whitish head. Very nice and crisp. Hints of citrus zest, spice, pine resin, grass, and a lot of hops. Dry, punchy, hoppy finish. Quite a great IPA.

Tasted like a typical sd ipa to me. Got a lot of earthy and resin tones. Perhaps a bit more malt than most sd ipas  Dry and bitter hops. missed all the pine citrus notes everyone is talking about. 22 oz from whole foods ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pour with Pat. Pours clean golden with thick fluffy off white head. Nose is citrus, tropical fruits. Solid citrus taste with sweet malt, onion, resin. Good hop bitterness. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Absolutely one of my favorites all time, you can smell the hops but they don't overpower once you drink it.  It has a dry finish and the malt/hop balance is perfect.  Bomber of course, but I've also had it out of the tap at the brewery, delicious.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a crystal clear golden straw color with a one finger head. Thin head persists all the way down. Aroma and flavor are of citrus and grapefruit. It has a medium body with a bit of sweetness to balance out the bitterness. Overall a well crafted and balanced brew. Ill be picking up a few more bottles of this.

Poured from a draft into a snifter at Hamiltons Tavern in San Diego, Calif. Two fingers of head when I got it. Color was hazy orange. Thick white head with good retention throughout the pour. 

Smelled citrus hops, mainly grapefruit and a bit of lemon or lime. Some sweet floral notes as well.

Tasted pretty close to the smell, only with more spices. Citrus hops - grapefruit and lemon going 1-2. Spicy bitter finish, couldnt quite put my finger on it.

Medium body. Creamy texture. Average carbonation. Bitter long ending finish. Crisp and refreshing.

Definitely a good beer. I think I need to try it again as this was after two darker beers. Definitely want to try it again.

UPDATED: JUN 26, 2012 Pours a light amber color, small light tan head. Grapefruit,  citrus nose.   Taste is the same with a lot of sweetness,  thick mouth feel.   Bigger,  badder version of alesmith ipa
22 ounce bottle from the broker. thin disappearing head.  Piney aroma and flavor with a mild floral note.
Draft. Wow......what a surprise from a light colored IPA. This thing boasts huge citrus hop aromas and a well balanced bitterness. Well done!

Light hop aroma (piny).  Flavor is one dimensional.  No mid palate hop flavor; lacks intensity that is expected in this style of beer. Overall, the lack of hop flavor and aroma really detracted from the overall enjoyment of this beer.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours golden with no head. Looks like lowly carbonated.
Aromas: Of my fuckin good! Exploding aromas of citrus, pine, resin, honey and apricots.
Palate starts out very fresh with loads of citrusy hops, moves over to a more oak like flavor which turns into a long caramelly sweet and smooth medium bitter ending. This is a masterpiece!

2012 bottle: I cant believe I havent rated this one yet, which may be a good thing as I dont remember any past batches being this great.   Pours a light golden hue, much lighter than I can remember previous vintages being, with a frothy white head with what may be the best lacing Ive seen in a beer.  You can see about 6 lines halfway through from each large sip Ive taken.  Aromas of the typical citrus, pine, a touch of straw and caramel and a hint of grass.  What got me this time was the mouth feel and finish.  The previous vintages of the summer I remember having more of an alcohol burn and a sweetness that typically accompany a brew this strong, but this year its dry and smooth.  Not overly hopped like many other double ipas, make this a very quaffable brew.   Ive always been impressed with both yulesmiths, but this definitely my favorite so far.

Pours a nice amber color with minimal head, super sweet caramel/toffee flavors. Has a nice alcohol bite and nice pine taste, sad to ser this one go.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a bright clear straw color with nice white head.  Nice lacing, huge nose of pear and tart fruit.  Slightly mary too but in a good way.  Immediate bright pear hoppy goodness no real malt presence but it lets the hops shine.  Juicy fruit hop finish that just goes on and on.  Yummy.

Bottled. Pours slightly hazy and deep golden body with a large, foamy off-white head. Good lacing. Nose of of floral and citric fruits and caramel notes. Sweet flavor with caramel, citrus fruits and pine. Medium to full bodied, oily texture and soft carbonation. More dry finish. A world class beer.

Wow.  Nice color with a great head(not golden but slightly orange and very clear), lacing on the glass throughout. Big orange and lemon zest on the nose. with earthy hops underneath and a very subtle touch of malt.  Such a great taste, what a nice bitter bitch that is still drinkable.  Very fresh, glad I got to this one so early.

65 cl bottle @ home. Rated on 05.06.2011
Aroma is rather rich and hoppy with lots of sweetish, exotic fruits, some pine needles and resin. Flavour is hoppy and nice with lots of exotic fruits, mango, some citrus, pine needles and resin. The sweetness tries to take over, but the bitter hops stop it from ruling. A bit too much CO2 on palate. One of the greatest DIPAs and definitely better than the sweet winter version.

Bottle to tulip glass poured a burnt orange with an enormous ever-lasting white head and active lacing.  Aroma filled with grapefruit, floral notes, and hints of honey, and corriander.  Taste is big citrus upfront, mainly tangerine and grapefruit, followed by palatable hop bitterness and slight alcohol flavor.  Excellent DIPA, but a cleaner, smoother finish would result in perfection.
171110: @ DØE Århus SYD tasting.  Hazy golden color with big off-white head. Max hoppy IPA, oh its nice.
de color anaranjado con un aroma inconfundible a lupulo, pan y alcohol. sabror a lupulos bastante resinosa, buen sabor a maltas cara y un final alcoholico muy agradable perfectamente integrado.

Bottle pours golden with an off-white head. Aromas of grapefruit and flowers with some sweet maltiness. Taste is citrus and floral with an amazing balance. Big hoppiness but not overly bitter due to the big malt backbone. A nice long dry finish on this one. Very well done.
UPDATED: JUN 15, 2012 Bottle. Aroma is overwhelmingly fresh hoppy, grassy, citrus. Captures summer perfectly. Taste is similar, grapefruit, pineapple, orange, strong bitterness.

65 cl bottle.
Rated on 20110605.
Pours clear golden color with a large head. Aroma of lots of exotic fruits, something nøgne brew elements, probably the yeast. An explosion of hoppy fruits in the mouth. The sweetness tries to break through but gets beaten by the bitterness of the hops. Quite balanced, somewhat like a smoothened version of Nøgne IPA. Excellent.
4517

Bottle from summer 2010. Pours an opaque orange honey colour with a good size head and carbonation. Aroma is subdued citrus fruits with a hint of honey. Taste is double west-coast ipa, grapefruit flesh and pithy bitterness throughout, with hints of spice coming through too. Finishes with a refreshing citrus and a nicely tingling and warming sensation at the back of the mouth. Excellent stuff especially considering age.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Perrys Liquors, Livermore. It pours light hazy orange, with a gigantic white head. The nose is sherbet, tangerine, orange, kumquat, mango, pineapple, straw and hay. The taste is orange sherbet, tangerine, kumquat, dried pineapple, hay, resin, straw, grass and a touch of alcohol warmth, with a long bitter-dry finish. Medium body, moderate carbonation and foamy mouth-feel. Great balance. Delicious DIPA.

Bottle: Slightly cloudy copper-colored beer with a small and rapidly vanishing off white head and a lightly alcoholic fruity hoppy aroma. Notes of peach, resin, pineapple, citrus, butterscotch, caramel. The flavor is medium sweet and heavy bitter with an almost exotic fruity long bitter aftertaste and a nice oily texture. Great IIPA.

From notes.  First reviewed 8/23/2010.  Poured from a 22 oz. bottle into a tulip. 

My pour out of the bottle has a hazy tangerine / orange color with a slight tinge of pink. A monster white head forms upon pouring. Great retention, and lace sticks all over this glass.

A light sweetness in the aroma, but I enjoy the strong hop profile. Mostly fruity grapefruit and tangerine, with a hint of floral notes as well.

The taste starts with a light, slightly sweet malt presence, but it not close to balanced. The pale malt contributes more to the general sweetness than anything. Strong and slightly varied hops provide most of the muscle. Juicy grapefruit, pineapple, and a bit of tangerine bitterness are the true focus. Finishes a bit bitter, with a hint of alcohol. 

The high level of carbonation leads to such a soft feel the beer sits upon the tongue like a pillow, with active bubbles creating a vibrating sensation as well. Light hop oil residue remains after each sip. Fuller than medium bodied, but it retains a light feel.

My personal preference is for a DIPA that wraps up clean, but the light amount of malt presence here really allows the hops to shine through. A solid brew that holds its own in a style full of great beers.

Pour light orange, with a very small white head. Aroma of pine, grass, citrus, peach, other tropical fruits and some malty caramel.
Taste is well balanced, sweet up front, with a nice long bitter finish. 
Medium body, with an average carb.

The beer poured golden and clear. Its head was quite large and white. Aroma was very hoppy, it had also citricness, floweriness and sweetness. Palate was medium bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were hops, citicness, fruitiness, floweriness, sweetness, malts and bitterness. Aftertaste was hoppy, fruity and bitter. A really tasty and good double IPA.

UPDATED: AUG 27, 2016 Bottle, 22oz, at Mikkeller. Its an almost clear one, dark golden in color and topped by a two-finger white head leaving some lacings. Fruityness, pine cones, peppery hints, a whiff of alcohol and a sweetish maltyness in the aroma. The flavor has sweetness and hoppyness well blended, with resin, fruityness, some alcohol and a nice bitterness. Full body, nice carbonation and some warmth. Lasting bitterness with pine cones. Nice. 110528 Bottle. Looking lovely, smells like hop heaven, like opening a bag of citrusy hops. Some malts too. Lots of hoppy flavors, citrus, pine cones, resins, grapefruit hop bag and then some. And a light malty touch. Not intensely bitter, still not really sweet. Lasting finish. Delicious indeed. 160827
pours hazy dark yellow with minimal head and lacing.  caramel and citrus aroma.  taste is lemon and pine. finish is bitter and citric.  good but not as good as the winter version.

2011 Bottle:
Slightly hazy, a bit blonder and whiter than the other version with a nice golden honey coloured body with a thinnish off-white microfoam head. Aroma of pungent citrus and resiny hops with a lot of alcohol noticeable, some coriander seed and even some curacao and orange sweetness. Medium to Full-bodied; Super pungent hop flavour up front with the pine and grapefruity hops really coming out with a large malt backbone. Aftertaste has a lot of hops, some citrus and grapefruit tastes and a full flavour that lasts for quite a while. Overall,a nice imperial ipa with a ton of flavour and a deep alcohol flavour that is quite potent - perhaps a bit too big in the 65 cL bottle, but since its alesmith, i dont think 75 cL would make it better :-) I sampled this 65 cL bottle purchased from Hollingsheads Deli in Orange, California on 06-December-2011 for US$8.99 sampled at home in Washington on 22-January-2012..

Cloudy maize color with white head, little lacing.  Aromas of earthy malts, mustiness.  I didnt get citrus in this one as described. Flavor is light sweet and bitter, a bit alcoholy.  Long dry finish, some alcohol bite on the back end.  Overall, not bad, but the alcohol is not hidden as well other DIPAs.  A bit malty, but good flavor.
UPDATED: JUL 22, 2012 Was able to get a fresher bottle in SD. This beer is over rated in my opinion.

Bottle.  Pours a slightly cloudy amber with little head, but some huge bubbles.  Aroma of citrus hops.  Flavor is rich with grapefruity hops.  A big malt backbone (a little malty for my liking, but probably fine by most peoples tastes), and a bitter finish.  Slightly undercarbonated.  A very good double IPA, although it didnt quite live up to my expectations (or the Winter YuleSmith).

Bottle. Golden colour with a medium-sized white head. Fruity aroma with orange, lemon and malt. Flavour is fruity with orange, lemon, some bitterness and sweetish caramel malt. Dry and bitter aftertaste, medium-bodied.
Bottle. Amber orange with white head. Nice hoppy nose. Some grapefruit.  Enormously bitter. Very well put together.

From bottle. Pours golden with some white head. Big citrus floral hop aroma. Similar tastes, well balanced and rounded, some resin, some pine, some fruit. No stand out character to this, just thoroughly excellent in a regards.
Bottle. Light gold with a white head. Big hops and citrus nose. Plenty more bitter hops in the flavour with a smooth bitter finish. A well put together beer.

650ml bottle. Slightly hazy golden body with a big, foamy off-white head. Strong and very pleasant aroma of citric fruits and some malt.Flavor is sweet malt, caramel, bitter and lots of citric fruits and pine. Fine body, nice aftertaste and a really balanced beer. Nice.

660ml bottle from Bierkompass

Pours yellowish orange with a bubbly head. Aroma has loads of hops, malts and fruits. Taste is very fruity and hoppy. Finish is bitter and fruity. Well balanced, tasty IPA.
Amber and hazy. White head. Bitter, fruity and sweet. Has some caramel aroma and flavour too. Its good.

Golden yellow with tinge of orange and small white head.  Aroma is grassy hay-like hops with some citrus and dried flowers.  Medium body, slight carbonation and small touch of alcohol.  Flavor astringent dry hoppiness with barely noticable malt background.  A reasonable IIPA.

Bottle.Pours golden with a nice white head. Aroma of peach, grapefruit,biscuit, grains and fruitiness.Flavor is sweet and bitter with some grapefruit and grains.Medium body, average carbonation.Nice hoppy beer.
Had it twice, not bad but I dont get YuleSmith that much. I had this one and their Porter but, its never as amazing as peolpe say they are. Ok DIPA the price.

Bottle from a trade, thanks! Pours a hazy gold with a white head that dissipates very slowly to the edges. Aroma has notes of floral and grapefruit hops with backing sweet grains and cereal. Flavor starts with sweet grains with a hint of vanilla that changes to grapefruit and floral hops in the finish.

UPDATED: NOV 20, 2011 Tasty IPA. The brewer does a great job in the description. Color is a yellow with an orange hue. Huge citrus aroma. Taste is very fruity and crisp but very smooth. Nice finish. Alesmith comes through again.

0.65l bottle @ The Bishops Arms (Vasagatan), Stockholm. Pours a light clouded orangish body and a small slowly fading and nicely lacing just off-white head. The aroma is so complex and nice; pine, citrus, caramel, cortex, kiwi, melon, strawberries, salt, apricot and some nice mild hints of alcohol. It has a average to lively carbonation level with a nice slick and light oily mouthfeel. Flavors are also so perfectly packed together that its hard to tear them apart. Still, Im gonna try: Lots of hops mixed and blended with pine, peaches, green grapes, kiwi, melon, cortex, branches and its leaving the mouth really bitter and dry. A beer yule just fall completely in love with. Halleyulea!

I let this bottle warm a bit out of the fridge and then poured aggressively to get a huge, off-white, thick, foamy, fluffy, billowy head that slowly subsides and some lace. Color is a very  slightly hazy, orange amber with a few slow bubble trails. Aroma is hugely hop, citrus, malt, oak, vanilla, resin. Flavors pretty much like nose with the citrus/hop on top with bittersweetness right under followed by those other things. Body is full with hop points and slightly soft carbonation. Finish is like flavor giving way to resin, very long, and has some alcoholic warmth. Well crafted beer, but too much hop for me.

Sampled at SBWF. Stockholm, September 29th, 2011. 

Creamy sweet aroma with big malt notes. Hops in the background that present itself in flavours of grapefruit, peaches and caramel. The body is special and quite enjoyable in this beer, its very sparkling. Flavours in the taste of caramel and toffee with a big bitterness. I have a feeling this bottle was quite old.
Bottle. Clear golden body with a medium white head. Aroma is fruity hops, mango, pineapple, caramel. Flavor is hops, pine, pineapple, grapefruit, caramel. Nice lacings. Medium carbonated. Tasty.

Serving: 22 oz. bottle from LeopoldStoch.  Thanks Brandon!  It pours a hazy gold with a small, soapy head.  The nose is full of resinous hops. The flavor is pine, resin, light caramel notes, and some bread.  Medium bodied with virtually no carbonation.  It may be a tad faded but its still pretty tasty.

UPDATED: SEP 30, 2016 Bottle 650ml @ mtaifas cabin
Pours clear golden with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, caramel, citrus, grapefruit, pine and peach. Taste is medium sweet and medium bitter with a long slightly dry, caramel, citrus, grapefruit, piney and peachy finish. Body is full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.
Bottle 660ml @ home
Pours cloudy deep golden with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, caramel and pine. Taste is medium sweet and medium bitter. Body is medium to full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [8 4 8 4 17 - 4.1 11/4/2011]

Bomber (8,5% ABV).
